Hybrid model: 2 days a week:
 Project Details:
  They are having data coming in from different source (40 different properties) and it needs to be cleaned, uploaded, and reported on.
 
 The key aspect of this is that they need someone who can Understand current state, do the mapping and put in SOP’s for the data, and then present these options to leadership of what this will be and the time it will take to accomplish. Pick up immediate project requirements onsite.
 
 Must have skillsets: 
 

PowerBI


Python and SQL coding


Understanding data, database structure, ETL processes


Understanding of API's


Must be able to communicate effectively with Senior leadership.

Nice to have Skills 
 

Strong understanding of cloud applications (Kintone, MRI, and Raiser’s Edge are their 3 applications)



Education & Certifications: Bachelors or Associates
 
Daily Responsibilities:


Working on the gap analysis phase of systems integrations for CH


Cleaning, loading, reporting data and data mapping


Understand how to access data from one tool and make it available to another or into PowerBI


process data from different sources and stage it for use across three different applications, and for business intelligence.


Meetings with the business stakeholders on research and findings and give options as well as timelines of how long it will take to get the work done


Collaborating on where they need to get to complete integration

**This is a fully on-site role. Hybrid/remote work is not available at this time**


 **We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time**



 We are excited to add an experienced 
      Senior Data Analyst to our team who is ready to take the next step in their career towards a path of leading and mentoring junior team members and utilizing their technical acumen to work cross-functionally within all areas of our business to drive decisions and impact strategy through actionable data insights!
     


 If you have a true passion for data, mentoring others, love to speak business, enjoy collaborating with technical and non-technical stake holders, and have a knack for advanced coding and data analysis – this role is for you!
     


 About RIVO Holdings:


       RIVO is an employee-centric financial services company in beautiful downtown San Diego. At RIVO, you will find we encourage collaboration across departments, recognition for hard work and performance, and foster a culture of growth. We recognize that everyone brings unique skills and experiences to their work and that the company is better for such diversity allowing the fulfillment of our core values: Respect, Integrity, Value, and Opportunity. If you share these same values we encourage you to pursue your interest and grow within the company – Apply TODAY!
     


 What You'll Do:


       The 
      Senior Data Analyst applies advanced coding, statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modeling techniques to draw data-driven insights that inform complex business decisions. The 
      Senior Data Analyst is responsible for owning end-to-end design, development, QA/testing, presentation, and transition to end-user stakeholders of specialized data analytics projects and supporting broader management and team development initiatives.
     

 Manage and supervise the end-to-end data project scope from design phase of business requirement gathering, available information analysis, architectural analysis, through to developmental phases, QA/testing, and transition to end users, ensuring successful user implementation and monitoring outcomes of implemented models for future iteration development.
 Oversee the day-to-day tasks of data analysts to ensure team success and results, understanding overarching department project prioritization and timelines in order to provide mentorship, coaching, and in-depth code review to identify performance-related optimization opportunities, diving deep technically when necessary to develop the skills and technical acumen of junior team members.
 Perform advanced ETL design, data mapping, and blending to cleanse and organize data in a way which addresses specific business intelligence needs and supports sophisticated analysis that improves back-end processes and/or end user experiences.
 Utilize advanced Python coding and MS-SQL query scripting to oversee advanced data migration projects and develop custom data models, algorithms, and machine learning technologies to code programs that help capture and organize relevant data.
 Lead architectural discussions and own the development of business intelligence, data warehousing, and data engineering solutions, working closely with architecture, DevOps, and business intelligence teams to build, install, configure, and maintain database platforms based on architecture specifications and business requirements.
 Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of multidisciplinary and cross-functional improvement of business units (Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Underwriting, Operations, Finance, and Accounting), identifying data trends and insights to solve significant or immediate business problems.
 Serve as project owner in leading BI and data analytics roadmap processes, maintaining project timelines, sprints, budgets, and risk mitigation of multifaceted, cross-functional, and executive level initiatives.
 Work with mid-level and executive level stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities or leveraging company data to drive business solutions, performing proof of concept processes to evaluate the plausibility of potential solutions for the organization.
 Deliver mid-level and executive level presentations of data findings and business solutions, communicating and presenting findings in a clear and intuitive manner for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



 Supervisory Responsibilities:


 Assist with monitoring of daily and weekly productivity and employee performance of junior team members in the Data Analytics department.
 Assist with the training and development of new employees in the Data Analytics department.



 Education & Experience:


 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Information Systems, or related field required; Master’s degree preferred.
 At least 3 years of work experience in Data Analytics, Data Engineering, or Business Intelligence as an Analyst of BI Developer required.



 What We are Looking For:


 Extensive knowledge of statistical analysis, data mining, predictive modeling, and machine learning methods, processes, and procedures.
 Advanced knowledge of ETL design, data mapping, blending, processing tools and MS-SQL server database systems and AWS cloud-based SQL Server (RDS) databases.
 Excellent experience with Sprint planning using Agile methodologies.
 Advanced technical acumen in MS-SQL, TSQL, and programming in Python.
 Advanced technical acumen in performing complex SQL queries, indexes, and CTE’s.
 Extensive knowledge of data modeling and data visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.
 Advanced competency utilizing machine learning technologies for building and interpreting data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques for analyzing datasets.
 Advanced knowledge of JavaScript, custom objects, workflows, triggers, and API integrations.
 Superior written communication skills, evidenced by background in preparing comprehensive reports, user documentation, and executive summaries incorporating complex, highly technical information.
 Superior presentation and verbal communication skills with strong ability to communicate technical concepts to business and end users at mid-level and executive level in an approachable manner that demonstrates empathy and authenticity.
 Superior problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
 Superior attention to detail, time management, and organizational skills.
 Superior ability to juggle competing priorities and context switch in a fast-paced environment as an effective member of a team.
 Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.



 We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you will be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. A reasonable estimate of the salary range for this job is $100,000.00 to $125,000.00. Individual salaries within those ranges takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to education; experience and training; licensure and certifications; knowledge and skill sets; and other business and organizational needs.

JOB OVERVIEW
 

   Assists with building technical tools and structures to gather and report on data in meaningful and useful ways, offering leadership a way to examine trends and derive insights.
 


   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 

 Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources to produce requested or required data elements and maintains data warehouse/data systems.
 Filters and “cleans” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct basic code problems
 Programs and maintains report forms and formats, information dashboards, data generators, canned reports and other end-user information portals or resources.
 Generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts.
 Assists with additional data requests as needed.
 Understands the existing ETL (Extract, Transform and load) workflows and assists in building future workflows.
 Other duties as assigned.



   TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)
 

 Flexibility: Flexible to work in 24 X 7 environment.
 Problem Solving: Identify potential problems, articulate/classify issues and able to determine next steps by referencing existing policies and procedures; apply sound analytical and reasoning skills during the problem-solving process; analyze the data gathered and reach a solution or provide a summary for a management decision when required.
 Service Oriented: Self-motivated to meet and exceed customer needs.
 Communication Skills: Ability to communicate professionally and collaborate with a diverse group of professionals as well as senior leadership; proactively seek guidance and feedback from others or more experienced team members (actively listen and communicate with others in a timely & professional manner). Ability to effectively present technical information.
 Time-Management Skills: Approaches work in an organized and systematic manner. Plans work and time effectively to manage conflicting or shifting priorities and achieve goals aligned with the business needs.
 Mentoring skills: Shares and transfers technical knowledge locally and globally when able.
 Teamwork: Ability to work effectively individually or in a group setting. Comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty.
 Interpersonal Skills: Ability to create positive interactions with colleagues and a team; actively communicate with others, including management, in a timely & professional manner; maintain a collaborative working relationship with others and peers to improve the team performance. Ability to deal effectively with a variety of personalities to establish and maintain effective working relationships with global IT Teams.
 Facilitation Skills: Ability to facilitate targeted meetings to identify business requirements and relative priorities from end users and customers.
 Data Synthesis: Ability to analyze complex workflows and processes. Knowledge of standard industry workflow patterns and their applications. Basic knowledge of user interface patterns and practices.
 Critical Thinking: Skilled at breaking down requirements into independent, valuable stories that focus on user’s goals rather than technical aspects of the system. Able to define and prioritize requirements for iterative development.
 Technical Knowledge: Must have working knowledge of PL/SQL. Experience working with large datasets as well as experience analyzing volumes of data through basic Microsoft Excel functions, like macros and pivot tables.



   EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
 

 Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field and 1-2+ years of related experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
 Experience with the following is preferred: Preferred knowledge of ETL tools like Informatica and business Intelligence tool like OBIEE, Tableau, QlikView etc.



   PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS / WORK ENVIRONMENT (if applicable)
 

 Work is performed in a designated professional office workstation and environment.
 Extensive use of office equipment to include computer, calculator, copier, fax, and other business related machines and software.



   Salary range: $78-102K.
 


 Disclaimer: This job description indicates in general terms, the type and level of work performed as well as the typical responsibilities of employees in this classification and it may be changed by management at any time. Other duties may also apply. Nothing in this job description changes the at-will employment relationship existing between the Company and its employees.

Description:

Job Overview
 Working independently and collaboratively under the direction of the Director of Enterprise Applications and Analytics along with the Data Administrator and Analytics lead, the incumbent will work closely with campus constituents and IITS team members to design, develop, implement, and maintain business intelligence solutions that meet the data needs of the university. Duties include development and design of database objects, ETLs, complex queries, data visualization, and reports. Additional duties include administration of reporting systems, documentation, training, and support of BI solutions to stakeholders.  ABOUT THE ROLE
 



   Jam City is on the hunt for a Lead Data Analyst to work on one of our highly successful titles, Cookie Jam. You will be responsible for providing both reactive and original insight at a project and studio level.
 



   The ideal candidate will be an expert in their field and have a solid understanding of the F2P market. This candidate applies and seeks out industry knowledge to develop creative approaches to analyzing data and analytics improvements.
 


 RESPONSIBILITIES

 Apply industry knowledge to come up with analytical approaches to analyze data and make project and studio improvements based on statistical methods.
 Extract complex data sets to understand game metrics in order to inform hypotheses, and create analytical experiments with clear and measurable success goals.
 Create reports summarizing business intelligence data for review by executives and managers; collaborate with senior managers and decision makers to identify and solve a variety of problems to clarify management objectives.
 Lead complex analytics projects applying mathematical approaches such as Multivariable Regression, Clustering, Time Series Forecast, etc.
 Train, manage, and supervise junior analysts on the team.
 Identify and propose improvements on analytics pipeline and operational process.
 Work cross functionally with other teams to provide business insight for decision making.


 QUALIFICATIONS:

 5+ years of experience performing analysis, preferably in the mobile games industry.
 Excellent quantitative and analytical skills; the ability to derive conclusions from data and clearly communicate findings is critical.
 Highly proficient in SQL, must be able to write queries to extract raw data and also load data into Tableau for visualization.
 Skillful in forecasting and manipulating data in Excel and/or Google Sheets.
 Master degree in mathematics, computer science, business or related fields strongly preferred.

 NICE TO HAVE 

Passion for games and empathetic towards the players.
 Curious, self-driven and thorough in analysis studies.
 Performs well with ambiguous tasks and ability to breakdown complex problems into actionable recommendations.

Overview: 
  This Data Analyst, Logistics role is your opportunity to make an impact and construct something from the ground up. You will lead analysis of distribution operations, transportation and inventory driving our focus on cost control and containment and execution excellence. Analyzing operations performance and initiatives that explore cost savings, service improvements and optimal efficiency are intrinsic to this role. You will be maintaining key data sources that support operational execution and excellence and providing data-based guidance to inform management’s strategies and plans and to formulize decisions.

 You have a strategy and plan to revolutionizes the operations process in the ERP system by capturing current state processes and builds recommendations for issue resolution, testing, training, and monitoring success of the ERP implementation. Your Influence on the future state of an agile operational network with the new ERP system will be recognized.
 Your curious nature to continuously explore the whys, hows, whats, etc., forge ahead to hunt down the details, drive continuous improvement and tell the story are core to who you are. The greatness is in the details.

 We are a goal-oriented team, working together to accomplish great things and are ready to learn from you as much as you learn from us.


 This role is a one-year fixed-term position with company benefits, and offers the flexibility of working a hybrid schedule.
  Responsibilities: 
 
 What You'll Be Doing



 In this role, you will utilize your strong analytical skills to bring data together to generate actionable insights, and then drive that insight to completion.
 

 Process Development

 Collaborates with customer service, supply planning, and 3PL partners to build processes in place to track delivered service and build best in class warehousing practices.
 Provides key support to the development & implementation of processes and systems related to the ERP implementation: “Inventory to Deliver” and “Procure to Pay” processes
 Leads business process mapping sessions with subject matter experts (SMEs).
 Documents detailed current state processes; identifies and documents key business requirements and risks. Supports the development of a minimum viable product to satisfy business requirements & mitigate identified risks.
 Supports and documents the development of future state processes
 Leads process redesign sessions for existing supply chain planning processes focused on improving the efficiency of the organization. Partners with supply chain team to map and document processes

 Logistics & Warehouse Operations

 Functions as a central liaison for all logistics and warehousing operations in the network
 Relentlessly pursues and analyzes the development of opportunities to reduce waste in transportation and warehousing (labor, materials, system/plant resources), streamlining processes, increasing performance standards, increasing accuracy rate, increasing capacity, reducing materials costs. Doing so by working with materials planning, manufacturing, customer relations, sales, and marketing which will result in control of our costs and increasing contributions to EBITDA
 Improves performance of customer orders, transportation, manufacturing, and warehousing sites throughout the network regarding productivity, capacity, schedule attainment, costs, deductions, compliance to QC standards. Make recommendations for action as needed which will result in our lowest operating costs and highest customer service leading to increased contributions to EBIDTA.
 Conducts scenario analysis for special projects to quantify cost and qualitative comparisons to aid in decision making
 Reports metrics to monitor performance of the distribution, transportation, and warehousing network, with key emphasis on operational throughput and holding costs calculates targeted KPI performance goals to align with our business targets, and implements corrective actions
 Leads business process mapping sessions with subject matter experts (SMEs) to document detailed operational processes for ambiguous fulfilment channels
 Owns Sarbanes-Oxley processes in Operations, embracing their continued integration into our business.
 Manages the inventory accuracy program to continually improve our processes in cycle counts and physical inventory counts and partners with external distribution centers and inventory team to execute the program
 Audits month-end financial analysis and control working closely with Finance and all Operations staff.
 Guarantee the accuracy of the tables in our ERP system that drive operations functions

 Issue Resolution
 Testing
 Training
 Monitoring Qualifications: 
 
 What You'll Bring to the Role


 3-7 years’ experience with process analysis and/or systems development within a Supply Chain function
 Experience working in process improvement for logistics, warehousing, and transportation operations a plus.
 Super star data analytics and critical thinking skills
 Project Management experience, collaborating cross-functionally and driving consensus
 Experience in working with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and Transportation Management Systems (TMS)
 Experience working with Tier 2 ERP systems (e.g., Net Suite), Epicor, Infor, SAP S4
 Some project management skills to enable the prioritization of tasks for self and others
 Bachelor’s degree in business or computer science preferred
 Certified by professional associations and ongoing education in Supply Chain management research and education preferred

  Are you passionate about transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive strategic decision-making? Join our team as a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping our company's growth.

 As a BI Analyst, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, identify analysis needs, and unlock new opportunities through data-driven discoveries. Your insights will empower stakeholders at all levels of the organization to make informed decisions, optimize operations, and drive business growth.

 This position works in a hybrid capacity (onsite & offsite) in our Chula Vista, CA facility.
 Relocation assistance is available.

 Primary Responsibilities:

 Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives and translate them into analytical solutions and actionable recommendations.
 Design, develop, and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations using industry-leading BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Python libraries).
 Perform in-depth data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights that address business challenges and opportunities.
 Extract and analyze complex data sets from various sources, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
 Proactively identify data quality issues, resolve discrepancies, and implement data cleansing and validation processes.
 Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging tools and techniques in data analysis, and propose innovative solutions to enhance reporting and analytical capabilities.
 Conduct training sessions and workshops to promote data literacy and self-service analytics across the organization.


 Basic Qualifications:

 Typically requires a degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) and/or Finance related degree unless prohibited by local laws/regulations and minimum 2 years of prior relevant experience or an Advanced Degree in a related field or in absence of a degree, 6 years of relevant experience.
 U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are authorized to access the financial management system due to government contractual requirements.
 Experience as a BI Analyst using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Python libraries or similar software.
 Experience with SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
 Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes.
 Experience with data cleaning, data wrangling, and data preprocessing techniques.


 Preferred Qualifications: 

Experience with statistical and machine learning concepts and techniques a plus
 Attention to detail and a passion for data accuracy and integrity.
 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable recommendations.
 Strong communication and presentation skills to effectively convey insights and findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

 ABOUT THE C3V RES PROGRAM
 The Community Care Coordination – Re-Entry Support (C3 RES) program provides comprehensive care coordination, service navigation, and housing assistance for adults who are incarcerated or recently released from custody and are experiencing homelessness or at-risk of homelessness.
 WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST?
 The Data Analyst develops, coordinates, and manages program compliance, quality assurance, records management systems, and program invoicing for the C3 RES program. In collaboration with the Program Director and Program Managers, the Data Analyst analyzes problems relating to quality management, evaluates alternatives, and identifies and recommends effective courses of action. Implement policies, procedures, and practice standards of program compliance in line with contract
requirements to help the Program Director and Program Managers identify and address organizational development issues.
Support the design, development, and implementation of programs.
Assist in the development and implementation of training programs aimed at developing staff capacity.
Track outcomes and monitor progress against meeting established goals.
Prepare weekly, monthly, and annual performance and outcome reports for review and submission to the funder by the Program Manager.
Analyze programmatic data to determine strengths and gaps.
Complete reports for timely submission as required by the County.
Provide back-up outreach and case management support to the region as needed.
Administer client databases including generating and analyzing reports, user management, and ensuring adherence to Homeless Management Information System (HMIS) policies and procedures.

Professional demeanor.
Strong organizational, prioritization, and time management skills.
Acute attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, including written, verbal, and the ability to clearly present data and ideas to a variety of audiences.
Strong interpersonal skills including a demonstrated ability to build partnerships and successful working relationships in a similarly complex environment.
Strong skills in multitasking, including the flexibility, adaptability, and effective prioritization necessary to coordinate multiple tasks and projects simultaneously and meet deadlines in a high-pressure, fast-paced, and time sensitive environment.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Demonstrated ability to maintain and execute confidential information according to HIPAA and all other applicable standards.

Experience with HMIS.
Experience electronic health record (EHR) database systems.
One (1) years of relevant experience.

Previous experience with social services and/or homeless services programs.
Experience with program contract management.
Demonstrated proficiency and literacy with computers, technology, and software used for work outputs including:


Microsoft Office software, especially Word and Excel.


Database systems.


Internet research.


The ability to quickly learn and master new applications and/or systems and assist others.

 Job Description
  The Senior BI Analyst will provide timely and professional onsite and remote support to Vuori Staff and partners in both a growing office and retail brick ‘n’ mortar Omni-Channel eco-system.
 Primary duties include working with key department stakeholders on validating source and end point data views, defining report/analytics requirements and specifications, teaming up with the tech Product Managers and business users, building workflow and data profiling exercises to ensure full transparency of data integrity, definitions, cadence, and exceptions. This position will be the hub for analytic/reports requirements as well as backend data requirements/needs. They are responsible for answering queries and addressing data and analytic/reports issues in a timely and professional manner.
 Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 Working alongside the Product Manager, develop report specific details and specifications from high level scope at the reporting level, adjusting course as necessary and communicating changes to requisite audiences.
 Build reports in PowerBI, DOMO(visualization tool) and other analyst/reporting tools, using the requirements and specifications derived from the requirements gathering exercises.
 With a high level of communicative expertise, represent and translate the “story of the numbers” via visualizations, graphs, dashboards, commentary, etc., appropriate to the audience and nature of the request.
 Working with systems and data engineers, source existing data to develop reports, or, in the event of nonexistent data, identify root source systems in which necessary data resides.
 Work with Data Governance manager to maintain knowledge base/foundation of KPI/Metric/Report definitions, intentions, and access.
 Manage relationships and time between projects and product owners while effectively communicating progress, obstacles, change of course, etc., as dictated by reporting dependencies and needs of business.
 Oversee and administer BI & Analytics tool/platform capabilities.
 Make technological adjustments to BI & Analytics tool/platforms to improve their performance.
 Develop algorithms and models to mine large data sets.
 Use statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and actionable results.




 Qualifications
 

 A four-year technical degree or equivalent work experience is preferred.
 7 or more years building and maintaining dashboards, analyses, reports, etc.
 High degree of proficiency with Power BI, including administration.
 Background with other BI tools and systems such as DOMO, Tableau, and Looker.
 Fundamental understanding of systems and data architecture.
 Strong SQL programming skills, including the use of SQL analytic functions and stored procedure development and maintenance.
 Strong excel experience (sumif, offset, vlookup, pivot tables).
 Exposure to analytics tools (Alteryx, SAS, etc.).
 Love for data and data storytelling.
 Proficient and knowledgeable on the systems and processes required to achieve consistently high customer satisfaction.
 Comfortable working in a matrixed organization involving cross-functional projects; strong communication and collaboration skills.
 Excellent organizational skills to manage priorities.
 Well organized, adaptable, and a clear thinker.

 Additional Information
  Pay Range: From $135,000 - $160,000 annually
 Benefits:

 Health Insurance
 Paid Time Off
 Employee Discount
 401(k)

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

 Probationary

 Full-Time

Description:








Position Summary
 Under the direction of the Associate Vice President, Enrollment Services, the Student Information Systems Business Analyst will work with end users in scoping projects, providing detailed business analysis, outlining business rules, and providing documents for processes handled by PeopleSoft Campus Solutions in support of Enrollment Services functions and operations.
 The Business Analyst will lead the design, planning, and implementation of complex projects, and work collaboratively with campus partners. They will provide consultation and facilitate the analysis and definition of business rules, service levels, and user requirements, and work cross-functionally to solve problems, improve processes, and implement changes. The Business Analyst will be responsible for the following:

Provide lead work direction to a team of analysts by providing training, assigning tasks, and prioritizing projects daily
Lead the analysis, configuration, and development of software applications for PeopleSoft Campus Solutions (my.SDSU) in support of Enrollment Services functions and operations.
Independently create written specifications, analyze, and recommend improvements and upgrades to configurations within the Student Information Management System and related systems, including the OnBase imaging/workflow system and Slate CRM
Test and debug software, ensure appropriate exception processing and error reporting, and translate data requirements into database designs.
Maintain PeopleSoft Campus Solutions training documentation for Enrollment Services functions.
Support annual updates to the Cal State Apply application database, including edits to Quadrant 4 custom questions.
Work with IT staff to test, configure and monitor the daily import of application data from Cal State Apply to my.SDSU.
Troubleshoot application download errors and oversee data cleanup efforts when necessary.
Develop queries for admissions units to help facilitate the application evaluation process
Support admissions-related modules within the SIS, including auto-review jobs and applicant checklists
Lead in the design, planning, and implementation of complex projects.

This is a full-time (1.0 time-base), benefits eligible, permanent/probationary position. This position is designated exempt under FLSA and is not eligible for overtime compensation. Standard SDSU work hours are Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., but may vary based on operational needs.
 This position is approved for partial telecommuting with onsite work in San Diego. This position is scheduled to work three days on campus and two days from the telecommuting site. However, the schedule may vary based on operational needs.





Department Summary
 Enrollment Services comprises Undergraduate and Graduate Admissions, Evaluations, Office of the Registrar, Prospective Student Services, and Enrollment Communications. Enrollment Services implements SDSU enrollment management policies and provides services to students from their initial point of interest in SDSU to their graduation.






Education and Experience
 To enter this classification, a basic foundation of knowledge and skills in applications programming and systems analysis and related programming support functions is a prerequisite. This foundation would normally be obtained through a bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer science or business, or equivalent training and applied experience. Foundation knowledge and skills for the Analyst/Programmer, depending on the position assignment, may include working knowledge of a specific industry standard applications programming language and knowledge of standard systems analysis techniques.





Key Qualifications

Demonstrated experience working with Student Information Systems, PeopleSoft Campus Solutions preferred
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of Four years of complex system analysis and hands-on project management experience, preferably in a highly regulated environment (education, healthcare, military, etc.)
Experience providing lead work direction
Project management experience in software development and system integration
Experience in the business analysis of application development and project management
General knowledge of SQL, object-oriented programming concepts, and relational database design
Working experience with Linux/Unix operating system environments is a plus







Compensation and Benefits
 Starting salary upon appointment is not expected to exceed $8,334 per month.
 Salary placement is determined by the education, experience, and qualifications the candidate brings to the position, internal equity, and the hiring department’s fiscal resources.
 San Diego State University offers a rich benefits package that constitutes a major portion of total compensation. For more information regarding SDSU benefits, please click here.
 CSU Classification Salary Range: $4,678 - $11,547 per month.

 At San Diego State University, we are a community of diverse individuals who have and represent many perspectives, beliefs, and identities. SDSU will make a conditional offer of employment, which may be rescinded if the background check reveals disqualifying information, and/or it is discovered that the candidate knowingly withheld or falsified information. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the continued employment of a current SDSU employee who was conditionally offered the position.

 Quartus Engineering Incorporated (www.quartus.com) is a leading provider of engineering services and integrated hardware solutions for a wide range of clients and industries. We employ advanced computer-aided engineering tools in the areas of optics, structural, thermal, and coupled analyses. We couple our engineering analysis capabilities with design, prototype, integration and test capabilities to create solutions for our clients that are of extraordinary value.


 What will you do?
 As a Senior Data Analyst in our San Diego, CA office you will be highly involved with the design, development and administration of the data infrastructure that is used to lead Quartus Engineering’s Business Analytics initiatives. The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for meeting with business leaders to gather requirements, retrieve data from applicable data sources and clean/prepare data for ingestion into a data warehouse, and build dashboards with BI tools such as PowerBI or Tableau. They will use data to gain insights into business opportunities and to influence strategy and decisions.


 Essential Job Functions:

Responsible for developing and maintaining data analytics infrastructure to support business strategic initiatives
Performs comprehensive analysis of source system data and data within the data warehouse to meet client business needs.
Build and maintain dashboards and reports with appropriate KPI’s and metrics to support business requirements


Work with ERP and other core system to manage flow of data into database for analytical reporting and forecasting
Develop plans for all stages of Business Analysis types such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive
Build, manage and maintain data warehouse with appropriate tools such as SQL
Meet frequently with stakeholders to review and analyze data inconsistencies to resolve in a timely fashion



 Location
 Position is based in San Diego, CA with a hybrid schedule.


 What are we looking for?

BS degree Computer Science, Mathematics or related field required
7+ years of experience with business analytics
Advanced knowledge with analytic tools such as SQL, Python, R, PowerBi, Tableau, Excel, etc.
Experience with creating dashboards, reports and visualizations to help business leaders better understand inefficiencies, trends and forecasting
Experience with Linux and HPC
Experience with project management
Self-motivated, goal oriented and a team player
Strong written and communication skills
Experienced leading people and groups both direct and indirect reports

This pay range represents base pay. In addition, you may be eligible for additional benefits and compensation.

About Dexcom 
Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. (NASDAQ: DXCM), develops and markets Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) systems for ambulatory use by people with diabetes and by healthcare providers for the treatment of people with diabetes. The company is the leader in transforming diabetes care and management by providing CGM technology to help patients and healthcare professionals better manage diabetes. Since the company’s inception, Dexcom has focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions that are best in class - while empowering the community to take control of diabetes. Dexcom reported full-year 2022 revenues of $2.9B, a growth of 18% over 2021. Headquartered in San Diego, California, with additional offices in the Americas, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company employs over 8,000 people worldwide.

A client service mindset with the capability to define and execute data-driven approaches to solving business questions. 
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with key stakeholders 
A high degree of intellectual curiosity and an acute attention to detail

Ability to work in a rapidly changing and fast-paced environment.

This position will serve as the demand forecasting and labor planning analyst for Field Services. This role will be the subject matter expert for reporting, analysis and metrics related to demand forecasting and labor planning. Responsibilities include ensuring strategic goals are met through forecast modeling, resource planning and monitoring performance for the enterprise.
 

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS :
 

Forecasts transaction volume and labor needs by technician type and skill-set for installation and service work across the enterprise, sites, business units and designated line of business. 
Accountable for achieving designated forecasting accuracy goals on monthly level for all assigned queues through various statistical methods. 
Maintains and analyzes actual volumes compared to forecasts and recommends changes to enhance productivity and customer satisfaction. 
Maintains staffing and headcount reports. 
Utilize SQL queries to access various databases for data extraction and may write code to automate reports and templates and consolidate data into reports 
Create scenario models to assist in complex decisions 
Conducts less complex data Analysis services for assigned product, business or other organizational areas. 
Works with assigned business partners to understand business objectives and priorities. 
Understand key challenges and issues and data requirements 
Prioritize tasks, agree on data sources, research methods and expected deliverables 
Meet established timelines. 
Analyzes current and historical performance, performs variance analyses of key metrics and identifies trends. 
Fulfills report / analyses requests by applying accepted metrics, methods and tools to analyze identified data sets. 
Creates and distributes both routine and ad-hoc reports, creates charts, presentations and timelines in support of department or business operations. 
Uses and may program statistical analysis software 
Troubleshoots issues with standard reports and works with clients on reporting difficulties. 



QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: 


Minimum 



BA/BS degree in a related discipline (i.e., Business, IT, etc.) with less than 2 years of experience required in related field; OR 4 years of equivalent experience in lieu of a degree. 
1+ years successful experience researching and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data in a related field (Field Operations, Customer Care, Data Analysis, Collections, Finance, Business Operations, etc.) 
1 year successful experience using Microsoft Office Suite applications in a work setting with strong knowledge in Excel 
Experience writing and executing queries of enterprise databases via SQL coding 
Excellent soft skills such as: interpersonal, leadership, presentation and collaborative to all for working effectively with teams throughout the organization 



Preferred 



2+ years successful experience researching and analyzing qualitative and quantitative data in a related field 
2+ years successful experience using Microsoft Office Suite applications in a work setting with strong knowledge in Excel 
Education and/or 2+ years' experience in data mining, working with large data sets, and recommending innovative analytical solutions 
Experience working in communications industry with a focus on telecommunications, data, cable 
Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI 
Demonstrated experience communicating with and influencing higher level leaders 


 USD 63,100.00 - 94,800.00 per year

Community Health Group is a locally based non-profit health plan that ensures access to high quality, culturally sensitive health care for underserved communities throughout San Diego County. We treat our 350,000+ multi-lingual staff like family, encouraging an atmosphere of collaborative teamwork, continuous learning, personal growth, and promotion from within. Recognized as one of the Top Workplaces in San Diego, CHG offers its employees such benefits as tuition reimbursement, a meditation room and yoga classes, a monthly Breakfast With The CEO, and memorable events throughout the year.


We know that by serving our employees well, they, in turn, will better serve our nearly 350,000+ membership. We have been recognized consistently for the excellence and sensitivity of our customer service by members, physicians, vendors, and a full range of health care providers. We are accredited by the National Committee for Quality Assurance and proud of our continuing company-wide Quality Initiatives.


We are currently recruiting for:


TITLE: Informatics Data Analyst


Target Hiring Range: $ 115,070.35- $126,577.39 Annually


EEO1: Professionals


POSITION SUMMARY
Meet the needs of system users by meeting with the appropriate people to determine business needs; gather information in order to define and program reports, dashboards, and other solutions to meet those business needs; coordinate business critical projects from beginning to end; monitor, maintain, and complete all required regulatory reports and processes.


COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS
Work closely with all departments necessary to ensure that the processes, programs, and services are accomplished in a timely and efficient manner in accordance with CHG policies and procedures and in compliance with applicable state and federal regulations, including the Department of Health Care Services (DHCS) and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS).


RESPONSIBILITIES

Support company leadership by building reports, dashboards, and business intelligence solutions based on current business and compliance needs.
Perform thorough data validation and reconciliation of reports to ensure accuracy.
Analyze healthcare costs, member demographics, call center information, referral patterns, provider network accessibility, and other company data as needed.
Provide analysis on enrollment, claims, authorization, and financial data as it pertains to Managed Care and construct necessary reports and datasets using SQL.
Provide technical assistance by working independently or with Informatics Manager to assist users in the design and planning of projects; write, test, troubleshoot, and implement solutions using the standards established by the department; provide maintenance support; work with Informatics Manager to develop necessary databases; attend ongoing meetings related to projects; working on multiple projects concurrently.
Provide information by writing documentation such as specifications, flowcharts, procedures, and training documentation; coordinate the development of solutions including reports and dashboards as required by the department, company, state and federal agencies; provide instruction and training for users and staff regarding new reports and solutions; participate in the evaluation of new software systems; provide solutions to users for technical and procedural problems; provide regular status reports to supervisor.
Define and execute appropriate methods; maintain and develop the technical skills necessary to support the current computer system; adhere to standard testing methodology to ensure that new or modified programs have no adverse impact on systems operation.
Enhance professional growth and development by participating in educational programs, reading current literature, attending in-service training and workshops, attending meetings as required, and participating on committees as directed.
Support the team effort by arranging and conducting meetings; assist in the care and maintenance of department facilities, computer equipment, and supplies; maintain departmental policies and procedures, objectives, quality assurance program, safety, environmental and infection control standards; perform other related duties as requested or assigned.
Maintain product and company reputation and contribute to the team effort by conveying professional image.










   Qualifications
  




EDUCATION 

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or related technical discipline.



EXPERIENCE/SKILLS

Five years of experience in database analysis, advanced SQL programming in SQL Server, Microsoft Access or equivalent relational database management tool.
Experience in developing database and report specifications, test plans, and system documentation is preferred.
Knowledge of SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Microsoft Excel, and Visual Basic.
Excellent oral and written communication; good analytical, logical and organization skills; excellent time management; ability to work on multiple projects concurrently; adherence to security requirements and confidentiality as required by the company and HIPAA.
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, or other BI tool preferred.
Experience in healthcare preferred.
Experience with QNXT, Vistar, or eVIPs a plus.


 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Minimum 30 lb. Lifting.
May be required to work evenings and/or weekends.


 
**Must have current authorization to work in the USA**

100% Dental and Vision insurance coverage

2 weeks PTO, 3 weeks after year 2

Performance based bonus potential
Tech equipment provided
Home office phone provided

MedImpact Healthcare Systems, Inc. is looking for extraordinary people to join our team!
 
Why join MedImpact? Because our success is dependent on you; innovative professionals with top notch skills who thrive on opportunity, high performance, and teamwork. We look for individuals who want to work on a team that cares about making a difference in the value of healthcare.
 
At MedImpact, we deliver leading edge pharmaceutical and technology related solutions that dramatically improve the value of health care. We provide superior outcomes to those we serve through innovative products, systems, and services that provide transparency and promote choice in decision making. Our vision is to set the standard in providing solutions that optimize satisfaction, service, cost, and quality in the healthcare industry. We are the premier Pharmacy Benefits Management solution!
 
The Scoop:
 Uses statistical analysis and other data analysis methods to work with Contact Center leadership team and support partners to identify and implement call reduction initiatives. Sets up and documents parameters for standard reporting packages in accordance with defined reporting protocols and enterprise standards. Creates ad hoc reports utilizing multiple databases and software applications. Gathers requirements for new report development, resolves ambiguities and conflicts, ensures requirements are complete, and communicates progress to internal and external customers as necessary. Works with internal and external customers to optimize the use of reporting tools and utilization/performance information. Adheres to strict procedural and quality standards, including thorough & accurate documentation and validation protocols. Relies on experience, judgment, business applications & systems knowledge, and technical skill to plan and accomplish goals. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Extent of supervision ranges from moderate, to minimal, to independent based upon demonstrated skill and performance level as defined for the position.

 
What You Get To Do: include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

 Works with Contact Center leadership to identify and implement call reduction initiatives based on data analysis
 Identifies issues affecting call volumes and customer access through data analysis methods
 Develops and executes standard reporting packages and ad hoc information requests
 Utilizes multiple databases while adhering to strict reporting protocols and business standards
 Writes and maintains detailed documentation of reporting activities including client specifications, expected outcomes, validation methodology & processes, test results, recommendations, version control, configuration design
 Creates and maintains a catalogue of PBM client report offerings
 Performs routine analysis of data to ensure accuracy and usability of information
 Recommends reporting enhancements; revisions to reporting parameters; and other innovative, value-added modifications to meet the needs of internal and external customers
 Utilizes planning, prioritizing, and organizational skills to ensure timely deliverables, high levels of quality, and efficient use of resources to achieve reporting timeliness and accuracy
 Maintains commitment to operational goals in the face of obstacles
 Collaborates and cultivates positive relationships with internal and external customers through delivery of sustainable, measurable, accurate, reliable, and timely results that meet or exceed customer expectations
 Promptly responds to service failures, resolves issues, and escalates concerns as appropriate
 Promotes continuous improvement by ensuring adherence to quality principles
 Seeks out and actively participates in business initiatives that contribute to service excellence
 Actively participates in continued professional development to stay up to date on the latest technical and information management enhancements and reporting best practices
 Based upon career path level, completes special projects and assignments (such as leading design reviews, gathering technical requirements, creating statements of work (SOW) for complex technical projects, mentoring/training staff, etc.)
 Provides back-up support to the Workforce Scheduling Analyst and Queue Coordinator

 
Supervisory Responsibilities
 This job has no supervisory responsibilities.


 Education and/or Experience
 For consideration candidates will need:

 One (1) year of related experience required in Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM), Pharmacy, Managed Healthcare or similar role; or an equivalent combination of education and experience
 A minimum of one (1) year of experience in a Contact Center environment



 Computer Skills

 Strong proficiency with MS Office / Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio and Outlook to create complex documents, manage schedules, and analyze data
 Business user of multiple software applications/processing systems 
Working knowledge of key business application such as MedAccess preferred 
Working knowledge of Contact Center tools and components including IEX Totalview, CUIC, Nice, IVR, PBX and telephony required
 Working knowledge of Oracle Golden 32, Business Objects, and SQL strongly preferred

 
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
 Project Management 101 Certification or equivalent training preferred.
 
Other Skills and Abilities

 Ability to effectively balance a high volume of work and a variety of tasks
 Ability to prioritize urgent issues effectively
 Strong analytic, verbal and written communication skills
 Detail-oriented with high degree of accuracy and organizational skills
 Able to effectively work as a team player as well as independently Excellent investigative, problem resolution, judgment and decision-making skills required
 Excellent consultative skills, working with internal and external clients at various levels in the organization
 Demonstrates ability to appear for work on time, follow directions from a supervisor, interact well with co-workers, understand and follow work rules and procedures, comply with corporate policies, goals and objectives, accept constructive criticism, establish goals and objectives, and exhibit initiative and commitment

 
Travel
 This position may require up to 10% travel. Attendance may also be required at various local training sessions and meetings.
 
The Perks: 
Medical / Dental / Vision / Wellness Programs
 Paid Time Off / Company Paid Holidays
 401K with Company match
 Life and Disability Insurance
 Tuition Reimbursement
 Employee Referral Bonus


 This position is eligible for Employee Referral Bonus at Level I


 To explore all that MedImpact has to offer, and the greatness you can bring to our teams, please submit your resume to www.medimpact.com/careers


 MedImpact, is a privately-held pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) headquartered in San Diego, California. Our solutions and services positively influence healthcare outcomes and expenditures, improving the position of our clients in the market. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets.


 Equal Opportunity Employer, Male/Female/Disabilities/Veterans 

OSHA/ADA:
 To perform this job successfully, the successful candidate must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


 Disclaimer:
 The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

ABOUT PRECISION DIAGNOSTICS:
 
Precision Diagnostics, based in San Diego, California is a fast-growing clinical laboratory that specializes in helping physicians monitor their patient's undergoing treatment for pain or substance abuse. Precision’s objective is to improve patient adherence/compliance with their prescription regimen and protect medical practices from liability. 
The role of the Business Analyst is to build cross-departmental processes that excel the operational efficiency of Precision. Effective business processes are essential to improving our services to our customers. Successful business process ensures Precision’s throughput of work increases at a lower cost to the organization. The Business Analyst must perceive, using experience and formal training, the organization’s needs while removing any constraints and blockages and deploy updated processes and procedures to achieve success.
 A successful Business Analyst will have experience in operating in a government regulated environment, preferably healthcare compliance.
 
ROLE OUTCOMES:

 Creating & enhance business process that enable departments to work effectively.
 Measurably improve efficiency by eliminating repetition of tasks and redundant processes.
 Responsible for ensuring that business processes increase throughput.
 Documentation of business processes.


 ROLE DUTIES:

 Contribute to development of standards and procedures
 Collaborate with Senior Leadership on roadmap planning and prioritization
 Communicate and validate requirements with relevant stakeholders
 Convert roadmap features into smaller user stories
 Write clear and well-structured business requirements/documents
 Coordinate with different departmental teams to produce better business outcomes
 Analyze process issues and bottlenecks and to make improvements
 Test business processes and recommend improvements
 Identify automation opportunities
 Establish and measure key drivers (reports, dashboards and visualizations)
 Develop and maintain status reports & executive briefs
 Supplement to an inclusive team culture


 WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE:

 4-year degree or equivalent career experience 
1+ years of experience writing procedures, working on technical projects 
Demonstrated experience in solution development and implementation 
Ability to translate complex information and processes into actionable clear conclusions and simplified automated processes
 Experience with Microsoft Azure, project management tools and procedure writing software 
Strong knowledge of business process analysis and continuous improvement.
 Experience in Lean Six Sigma & Dev Ops
 Become fluent in Precision’s end-to-end business objectives and build roadmaps that can be presented to the executive leadership team 
Excellent writing and communication skills
 Ability to function well in a virtual team working independently while managing time and priorities in a remote environment 
To be successful, you agree that technology is a key part of every business process and you will make new technology adoption part of your routine 
Become fluent in Microsoft 365 (formerly Office635) applications assigned to your role. Common applications include: Teams, Word, Excel, Tasks and Planner 
Complete training in a timely manner that is assigned to you. Training is primarily conducted via Microsoft Learn modules and is assigned based on: 
   
Position/Job Role – Most positions require a core set of Microsoft 365 working knowledge 
Project Role – As member of a project team, you may be required to complete training before you can engage with the project team or commence project work 
Ad-Hoc – Based on review of your performance via support requests, training modules will be assigned to increase skills 


ADDITIONAL JOB CONSIDERATIONS:

 This position is Full-Time with flexible working hours, minimum of 40 working hours required per week.
 This position is remote with occasional onsite requirements for meetings or projects. 
Annual salary range for this role is $64,480-$100,000
 Must be able to sit at a desk for prolonged periods and working on a computer. 
Comprehensive benefits package: Medical, Dental, Vision, and additional optional coverages 
401K with company match 
Paid time off and paid Holidays

 
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

job_location: Hybrid remote in San Diego, CA 92101
job_description:
Sempra: Where opportunity powers impact​ 

 ​ 

 At Sempra, we tackle the biggest energy challenges that face our industry. Our high-performing team leverages the full capabilities of our organization to serve 40 million consumers across North America. By collaborating and challenging one another across multiple disciplines, we inspire our best work, ideas and innovation. From increasing liquified natural gas (LNG) capacities to reducing carbon emissions to helping people prepare for the realities of climate change, we are committed to building a better energy future for all. 


Primary Purpose:
 The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for supporting the Director of Corporate Sustainability and Chief Sustainability Officer with a methodical approach in examining ESG trends, market risk assessment/analyses, peer benchmarking, keeping abreast of ESG regulations/policies in local (CA, TX), national, and global (Mexico, Canada, EU) that can have material impact on Sempra’s position as a global leader in ESG. This role will also support advancing technology related process improvement projects in the Corporate Sustainability organization. This individual is responsible for reviewing and understanding end to end business requirements through engagement with finance, audit, risk, IR, strategy, legal, and others to identify and address operational, financial, and technological risks. 


Duties and Responsibilities:


Perform market research in collecting data on ESG peers and industry and collate consolidated information into actionable items, reports, and presentations; effectively interpret data, perform SWOT analyses, and catalogue findings to databases.
Maintain a constant and forward-looking pulse on ESG industry practices and trends, remaining fully informed of market trends, research, studies, and best practices.
Support the implementation of business solutions by individually or collaboratively developing solutions; demonstrate the ability to learn new technologies and apply functional understanding in the development of appropriate solutions; Demonstrate and apply understanding of governance in the areas of data management and process improvements.
Participate in multiple projects by driving the advancement of project deliverables; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths and managing relationships; Provide project level analysis which includes producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, process flow diagrams, future state proposals.
Support with PowerPoint presentations - varying from internal information to executive level presentations.
Support Corporate Sustainability team by performing admin related tasks. Additional tasks include reporting writing and maintenance. Provide backup support as a cross-functional team member as needed; ODAA.
Performs other duties as assigned (no more than 5% of duties).

Education:


Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field required.

Experience:


5 years relevant experience.
Must reside in Southern California or be willing to relocate upon hire.
We offer a hybrid work environment. Although the schedule may vary, typically this will allow you to work from the office three days per week and work remotely on the remaining workdays.

Skills and Abilities:


Experience with data analysis, must be proficient in MS Excel. Must have experience integrating data from other systems.
Experience with research and market trend analyses.
Experience with ESG technology platforms like Intelex and Workiva.
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and drive project initiatives without losing momentum.
 Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

SUMMARY: Transportation Data Analyst opportunity to get involved with technology consulting in the areas of : 1) transportation electrification, 2) connected and autonomous vehicles, and 3) alternative fuel vehicle technologies. Qualified candidates will be graduates with a degree in engineering, data science or a technical field. 


DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:


Analyzing electric vehicle operational and charging session data
Creating data frameworks for automated data transfer
Conducting quality control on received data sets
Anonymizing data by removing personally identifiable information (PII)
Characterizing data by removing proprietary information
Adding cleansed data sets into the database for post processing
Running utilization and other reports based on various attributes
Creating visually interesting tabular and graphical summaries
Analyzing fleet vehicle stock and operational data to assess suitability and performance of alternative fuels and technologies compared to conventional baseline technologies
Manage news scraper to collect information on advanced technology and alternative fuel market trends
Tracking utility transportation electrification activities
Contributing to technical studies, reports, and summaries related to transportation technology trends

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor’s degree in an engineering, data science or a technical field from an accredited university
Data analysis software and programming experience (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Python, Geographical Information System [GIS], Microsoft Power BI, Tableau)
Excellent communication skills (verbal, interpersonal, and written)
Interest in energy efficiency and clean energy with specific emphasis on transportation technologies such as: alternative fuels, vehicle electrification, and connected and autonomous vehicles
Excellent organization and time management skills
Two (2) or more years of professional experience
Proficient in Microsoft Office, with advanced Excel skills preferable
Successful when working on self-managed tasks
Ability to work within a diverse team
Comfortable multitasking on time-sensitive tasks without diminished quality of work

PREFERRED REQUIREMENTS:


Bachelor’s degree in engineering from an accredited university
Master’s degree in data science or equivalent
Five (5) or more years of professional experience
Experience designing and managing databases
Experience developing ETL Pipelines and automated data QAQC
Experience handling vehicle telematics data sets
Experience working in cloud computing environments (Azure, Google Cloud, AWS)
Advanced data analytics and visualization (e.g., Python, R, Matlab) or GIS program use and results analysis
Alternative fuels and transportation electrification familiarity
Electric vehicle and charging station data collection and analysis
Transportation systems modeling
 VSE is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, Protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
