Data Intelligence, LLC (DI) is searching for a full time Tactical Data Link (TDL) Analyst. This position is onsite in Point Loma, CA. 

 In this this position, the candidate will conduct Joint Message Standards analysis that include review, analysis and development of message standards (TDL, VMF, and USMTF), related to interoperability and system documentation. They will provide support with technical documentation review, attend interoperability meetings, and participate in the discussions, providing input for the proposal of new and revised interoperability requirements. 


Job Responsibilities:

Specific support activities will include:


Review, analyze, and provide written evaluations on system specifications, message standards, Interface Change Proposals (ICPs), and related interoperability documentation as required.
Execute evaluations and prepare reports in adherence to the applicable military and government standards, specifications, and formats.
Attend and provide technical subject matter expertise during joint interoperability technical meetings in support of the Marine Corps representative at Joint or Combined Standards meetings; report on the findings and decisions following meetings.
Provide technical and engineering support for the review, analysis and development of Marine Corps documents that provide Marine Corps users (tactical systems operators, planners, commanders, interoperability specialists, and tactical system acquisition personnel) with information that assists them in the performance of their duties.
review and analyze assigned documentation to determine technical accuracy of content, impact on command-and-control operations systems, compliance with existing standardized rules and procedures, the viability of joint interfaces, and the interoperability of Marine Corps C4I systems.
produce the Marine Corps Tactical Data Systems Reference Guide (TDSRG) and provide updates and improvements to the document.
Support in the review, analysis and development of tactical data standards that support the tenants of DOD and Marine Corps Net Centric Data Strategies; provide technical expertise supporting the migration of tactical C2 data to adopt the best approach toward net centric operations; produce analytical reports of technical studies/data modeling efforts conducted in support of the Net Centric migration of tactical C2 data as required.
Support the development and evaluation of native schemas and TDL information exchanges.
investigate various technologies, such as JAVA Script Object Notation (JSON) application schemas, to enhance TDL net centric capabilities.

Required Skills/Experience:


3+ years of experience with tactical operations, research, analysis, planning, designing, developing, or evaluating systems.
Familiarity with Joint Message Standards Analyses
Understanding of TDL, Variable Message Format (VMF), and USMTF and experience with Interface Change Proposals (ICPs)
Familiarity with iSmart/eSmart
Secret Security Clearance required

Desired:


BS in a technical field
Military Operational experience
 Data Intelligence, DI is an established small business that has supported the critical missions of our government clients since 2005. We provide full life cycle system development, systems engineering, cybersecurity, and supporting analytical and logistics support to C4ISR and other complex systems. We are an equal opportunity employer that offers competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, a team-oriented environment, and opportunities for advancement. Our excellent employee retention record reflects our employee focus. We work with Veteran's organization to proactively hire those who have served our country. We offer medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k, PTO and 11 paid holidays. 

 Data Intelligence is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

job_title: C5 ISR Data Scientist Analyst II w/ TS Clearance /SCI preferred
job_description: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.  Work you'll do   Design and implement statistical models to analyze complex data sets and generate insights for business stakeholders  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data-driven insights and opportunities to optimize business operations  Develop predictive models to forecast future trends and outcomes  Apply machine learning techniques to build predictive models and identify patterns in data  Develop data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights to stakeholders  Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ETL processes  The team   Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.  The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.  Qualifications   Required:  Bachelor's Degree in engineering, computer science, or other technical field + 3 years of relevant data science experience  3+ years of experience working as a data scientist in a professional services consulting environment or supporting a US Navy Program Office  Knowledge of Department of the Navy Configuration Management processes and PEO C4I databases including SPIDER, CM Pro, NSERC, and Naval Lift  Strong programming skills in Python, R, or similar languages  Experience with statistical modeling and machine learning techniques, such as linear regression, decision trees, clustering, and neural networks  Active Top Secret Clearance required and /SCI or SCI eligible  Preferred:   Bachelor's or Master's Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics or a related field  Familiarity with SQL and database systems  Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js  Active TS/SCI US Government Clearance

The Position
 
 Note: This is not a remote role and relocation assistantance is not being offered. All candidates must be locale and open to working onsite a minimum of 3 days per week.

 POSITION SUMMARY
 Analyze complex business problems to be solved with automated systems, including, but not limited to the ERP system implementation. Conducts analysis, design, evaluation, modification, testing and implementation of enterprise-wide process improvement initiatives in coordination with the site owner. Evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts, disseminates high-level concepts into details, distinguishes needs, identifies root cause of gaps and creates logical and innovative solutions. Organizes and facilities cross-functional project teams to address business or systems issues acting as the liaison between the business/site owner and the ERP implementation team as needed.

 ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

 Develops a proficient understanding of the business process and needs
 Works closely with assigned groups to assist with defining business requirements and see them through system implementation
 Acts as a liaison between the business/site owners and the technical systems groups
 Works with all parties to ensure proper testing of defined functionality
 Works with all parties to assist with user acceptance testing and training for users
 Other duties as assigned by management
 Uses project management concepts to assist with work plan development and managing of project timelines and milestones.
 Develops and maintains internal and companywide contacts to maintain & nurture technical knowledge.
 Monitors work to ensure quality, and continuously promote Quality First Time.
 Adhere to ISO, GMP, GDP, SOX, and other regulatory requirements and supply chain best practices and guidelines.


 Requirements:

 4 years of related experience with degree or 7 years related experience without degree
 Strong knowledge of ERP/MRP systems (SAP strongly preferred) with concentration on planning/purchasing logic, item master & BOM structure, and MRP ordering parameters
 Demonstrated ability to handle varied and complex inventories with non-traditional units of measure.
 Proven expereince performing with a high level of accuracy
 Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel
 Effective analytical problem solving, judgment and decision-making skills are required
 Strong time management and organizational skills in a dynamic, constantly changing environment
 Requires strong communication skills, attention to detail and the ability to communicate effectively with vendors, customers and within all levels of the organization.


 CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS (if applicable)

 Training in GMP, ISO, and APICS certification desirable


 WORK ENVIRONMENT
 The essential functions of the job are usually performed in an environmentally controlled facility where the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. This position may involve a combination of office and biotechnology laboratory environments. The employee may be exposed to hazardous chemicals, blood borne pathogens and automated equipment.

 While performing the job duties, the employee is regularly required to sit; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand and walk. The employee may sometimes be required to lift and/or move up to 35 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.

 Assist with special projects as requested and perform additional duties as required



   Who we are
 
 GenMark is now a proud member of the Roche Group, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. As a global leader in healthcare, Roche Diagnostics offers a broad portfolio of products, tools and services that help in the prevention, diagnosis and management of diseases like HPV, HIV, hepatitis and diabetes as well as other medical conditions, such as fertility and blood coagulation. With the addition of GenMark to the Roche Group, syndromic infectious disease diagnostics is now added to the long list of disease states and conditions that the Roche Group addresses. GenMark’s ePlex true sample-to-answer system offers unique solutions to address the most significant challenges facing clinical laboratories, while supporting hospital systems to deliver patient-centered, value-based care. ePlex streamlines the diagnostic workflow from physician order entry to the final test report and is the true sample-to-answer solution designed to improve patient care, reduce costs, and increase lab efficiency. GenMark is headquartered in Carlsbad, California.

Position Title: Principal Data Analyst (San Diego) JWED RDER

 This position requires a Top-Secret Clearance. In order to be considered, you must have an active Secret or Top-Secret Clearance.

 General Position Description:
 XSITE LLC is looking for qualified candidates to provide experimentation, data analysis, network architecture integration, modeling & simulation, software engineering research and development services in support of wargaming and experimentation. Experimentation will entail the full range of new initiatives including system requirements, design, implementation, and validated metrics aligned to Concept Required Capabilities (CRCs). Efforts will examine the architecture, engineering, functionality, interfaces, and interoperability of proposed initiatives that are developed and submitted to meet DoD CRCs. Evaluations will include operational experiment design and construction, operations and requirements analysis, concept formulation and development and feasibility demonstrations. Additional efforts will include requirements verification and validation, engineering & functional analysis, technical documentation, machine learning & artificial intelligence utilization, networking data design and integration with the Joint Experimentation Network (JExNet) as well as modeling & simulation testing, evaluation, and demonstration.

 Job Description:

Responsible for meta-analysis experimentation support by developing standard methods for systematically combining pertinent qualitative and quantitative data from experimentation to develop conclusions. 
Use various sources of data to confirm outcomes based on multiple experiments to enable higher confidence decision making and ensure standardized data analysis across differing types of experiments such as simulations, wargames, tabletop exercises, and field experiments 
   
This shall include the design of linked experiments using different methodologies, and search across JExNet to identify opportunities to integrate events from different experiment types to increase the analytic strength of overall findings. 

Determine how to do analysis and assessment and comparison of event in context of another event to inform gaps/needs and use it in conjunction with other events to draw larger conclusions and assign confidence values to outcomes from different types of events. 
As part of these analysis duties, the contractor shall also be capable of 
   
Contributing towards application of statistical approaches for analysis of joint experimentation data. 
Participating in development of novel quantitative approaches, or customization of statistical methods per project needs. 
Identifying analytical and computational bottlenecks involved in analysis and developing techniques to resolve them efficiently. 
Ensuring appropriateness and applicability of mathematical, statistical, or research techniques utilized 
Assisting in evaluation and documentation of statistical methodologies used; and preparing recommendations based on mathematical or statistical findings. 
Participating in report preparation to accurately summarize experimentation design, methods, analysis plans and interpretation of results. 
Performing meta-synthesis of different experimentation types using Bayesian methods to establish confidence intervals in concept required capabilities (CRCs)



 
Basic Qualifications:

BS degree in Data Science, or Computer Science; Information Systems, or Information Technology; Electrical, Software, or Systems Engineering.



 Desired skills:

Ten (10) years of direct work experience with designing and maintaining data models and structures along with data extraction and preparation processes. 
Six (6) years working with similar data structures/environments as identified in the Statement of Work (SOW) with specific experience to include: Validating data, Data Team collaboration, usage of database applications & analytical tools, data query & collection processes providing accurate and appropriate interpretation of data.

Clearance Requirements:

Top Secrete/SCI required to work on program
Active Clearance preferred and be eligible for a Top Secrete/SCI with a successful background investigation completed.



 Location: San Diego, CA / Customer Site

 Travel Anticipated: 10% or less

 Timing: XSITE anticipates a start date of: April 2023


 XSITE LLC, a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business, provides full spectrum systems and systems-of-systems engineering and integration services and solutions for space, C4ISR, cyber and enterprise information systems. We strive to deliver expert-level systems engineering and technology integration services at affordable rates so mission, capability and user success are the #1 priority.
 XSITE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job_title: Data Analytics Specialist (Fundraising & Donor Database Specialist - Blackbaud non-profit applications) - Donor Services
job_description:
Rady Children’s Hospital Foundation seeks a highly-motivated, detailed-oriented team player to support our efforts with our fundraising databases. The Data Analytics Specialist position will report directly to the Director of Research and Data Analytics and join our established Data Analytics team. The ideal candidate will want to thrive in a fundraising setting; be an excellent ambassador and representative for Rady Children’s and the Foundation; work efficiently under pressure and be able to meet deadlines; demonstrate good decision-making; and be proactive and solutions-focused. 

 This position is key to the Development team and will require a high degree of knowledge for all functions in fundraising to support our Major Giving, Annual Giving, Planned Giving, Grants, Corporate Giving, Marketing, Events, and Stewardship teams. This position will require cleanup of our fundraising databases, proposal tracking, moves management, pulling lists, queries and reports, training of staff, and writing instructions; and plan and execute other projects as assigned within the scope of responsibility. 


JOB SUMMARY:
 Under general supervision, the Data Analytics Officer will provide expert support at Rady Children's Hospital Foundation in the areas of data analysis, data management, and business solutions to help achieve Foundation goals. This detail-oriented, data-minded, team player will be responsible for creating simple and complex data files, manipulating raw data, and generating ad hoc reports to support the Foundation office. Collaborating with Foundation staff to better define and understand reporting requirements and effectively translating non-technical concepts into reports that are understandable, actionable and timely. Assist the Director of Research and Data Analytics in creating and maintaining detailed analytics related to donations and constituents, management metrics, and giving trends that support Fundraising efforts. Provides excellent customer service and support for Foundation end users that utilize the Blackbaud non-profit applications and services. Monitor the system to maintain a high level of data integrity. Review and analyze program issues, making recommendations to department leadership to improve system, innovation and cost saving solutions. Act as a liaison between vendors and Foundation staff to resolve system issues and/or to enhance user performance. Create and execute special projects as assigned by VP of Operations and/or Director of Research and Data Analytics. Responsible for generating year-end tax summary statements and annual year-end surveys. Maintain policies and procedures around data management and general user training. Assist training of development officers and staff, as needed. 


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
 Bachelor’s Degree 

 3 years of experience 

 Bachelor's Degree or 3 years of relevant work experience in lieu of a Bachelor's 


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
 5 years of experience 

 Technical knowledge around Blackbaud non-profit applications, software, and services 

 Detail-oriented, data-minded, and team player 

 Technical knowledge of ImportOmatic and/or other vendors that are partners with the Blackbaud systems 

 The expected hiring range for this position is $28.08 to $38.61 

 Rady Children’s Hospital is committed to compensation that is externally competitive and internally equitable. We demonstrate this commitment by conducting regular market reviews to remain competitive with organizations of similar size in the nonprofit, healthcare sector. The range listed above does not represent the full salary range for the position but is the expected hiring range for qualified candidates. Compensation decisions consider a variety of factors including experience, education, licensure, unique skillsets, organizational need, and internal equity.

Description:
The Logistics Analysts (Ashore) should have experience in and knowledge in stock control operation; Financial Improvement and Audit Readiness (FIAR) program; Navy Working Capital Fund (NWCF) policies and concepts; financial management in the Navy; ashore aviation support programs and policies, I-Level maintenance operations, development of aviation supply policies and procedures, and NWCF policies and concepts; automated aviation supply/maintenance management; commonly used supply system query programs, shipment channels, development of aviation supply policies and procedures, AVCAL/COSAL outfitting support; and standard supply processes.
The Logistics Analysts provides services in connection with Navy logistics operation, financial management and inventory management.
The Logistics Analysts provides services in connection with aviation supply/logistic management for ashore activities; provide analysis and measurement of supply effectiveness of Aviation Supply Division (ASD); collect, review, monitor and analyze data received from ashore aviation units; conduct training, assessment, and inspection.
The Logistics Analysts provides services in connection with Aircraft Engines and Inventory Readiness Reporting system, familiarity with NAVAIR policy, monitor aircraft engine status, and provide technical and administrative support to DeckETR.
The Logistics Analysts provides services in connection with CASREP monitoring including Broad Arrow and AWP, conduct stock queries for high priority items, track CASCORs, and shipboard engines monitoring.
The Logistics Analysts provides services in connection with Technical Publications and Directives Library support services.

U.S. Citizenship
Must have a current DoD Secret Security Clearance
Associate degree in Logistics, Business Administration or a related business discipline or 15 years of experience and knowledge in US military logistics operation afloat and ashore.
Experience and knowledge in Navy Logistics operation; Navy financial management, stock control operation, inventory management of the Navy Working Capital Fund (NWCF), supply and maintenance operation, configuration management, hotel service, food preparation, laundry and ship store services, retail operation; disbursing and postal operation, and all other related shipboard services as they relate to large afloat activities.


Proficiency in stock control functions, ERP, ASD operation, NALCOMIS, AIS, RSUPPLY, NAVSUP OneTouch, FIMARS, and NAVAIR processes.
Proficiency in automated supply/maintenance management; commonly used supply system query programs, shipment channels, financial management procedure, and standard supply processes.
Proficiency in NAVSUP One Touch Support, ERP, FIMARS, Broad Arrow, AWP, R-SUPPLY, and familiarity with Naval messaging.
Proficiency in maintenance administration management and technical publication library management.
Proficiency in Naval Aviation Logistics Command Management Information system (NALCOMIS), AIRSS, RT-79, XRAY, DeckETR, NAVAIR policy and procedure, EPSM and FIAR.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite products (Outlook, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Possess strong verbal and writing skills
Superior communication skills.

job_description:

 Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions. We are looking for individuals with functional experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance that have been heavily involved in an IT systems implementation.
 Streamlyne offers modules to support Pre-Award (including System-to-System proposal submission), Negotiations, Post-Award (including Subaward), IRB, IACUC, IBC, Conflict of Interest, and Export Control. Expertise in multiple areas is highly preferred.

                Business Analysts (BAs) at Streamlyne are customer-facing, play many important roles, and have significant impact on the growth of the company and improvement of its products.
              

























A fully-trained member of the BA Team is expected to contribute as follows:
 Marketing Duties





Complete Request for Proposal (RFP) responses and coordinate the assignment and management of RFP tasks with teammates.

Execute software demonstrations within your area of expertise and/or coordinate participation from other analysts in demonstrations as required.

Travel to onsite demonstrations as requested (usually with other team members), manage onsite technology, and manage prospect relationships/follow-up.

Coordinate prospect software trials and serve as point of contact for related communication.

Provide input into scope analysis and solution architecture for contract development as requested.

Travel to industry conferences and events to foster industry relationships and develop leads.



Implementation Duties


Lead classroom or remote sessions to train clients on application functionality.

Lead onsite or remote analysis sessions with clients to guide them through configuration and customization decisions in alignment with their business requirements.

Successfully distinguish user requests from true underlying needs.

Create and maintain project artifacts, such as configuration documents, business requirements documents, and functional specifications.

Identifying, delegating/executing, and tracking the results of tasks that arise out of client discussions, to include configuration tasks, testing tasks, data mapping tasks, documenting tasks, general problem solving, etc., in alignment with a defined project schedule.



Product Development Duties


Participate in the development of the product roadmap, requirements, and specification documentation.

Work with development teams to translate product requirements into technical requirements.

Analyze and critically evaluate industry product information gathered from multiple internal and external sources, reconcile findings, and decompose high-level information into product details for future product improvements.

Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of any given project.



This Position Requires You To:


Be able to work at a pace required by a rapidly growing, profit-driven Ed Tech business.

Be driven to acquire and internalize new information quickly.

Possess a natural aptitude for software-supported business processes and design, to include an appreciation for formal logic and a genuine love of problem-solving.

Feel comfortable speaking in front of small and large groups of people.

Coordinate assigned work with other team members and follow up on delegated items.

Possess an intrinsic passion to pursue assigned work to the highest personal ability and integrity.

Be kind, flexible, proactive, and able to maintain productivity in the face of ambiguity.

Appreciate a fast-paced environment in which no two days are the same.

Fit into a group of highly integrated, highly communicative, fundamentally unpolitical and tightly knit but geographically dispersed team.

Proactively analyze personal progress, project progress, potential risk areas, and proactively communicate that analysis to management.

Be effective at working remotely, generally from home, serving primarily East Coast business hours but responsible for Coast-to-Coast time zones.















Qualifications





Bachelor’s degree or 7 + years’ experience in Business Analysis.

5 + years’ experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance.

Hands on experience with a research administration system.

Active participation in at least one full-lifecycle implementation project.

Superior written and oral communication skills.

Exceptional presentation and meeting facilitation skills.

Experience with and/or demonstrated ability in working as part of a geographically dispersed project team.















First Consideration Will Be Given To Candidates With:





Hands on experience with Streamlyne, Coeus, Cayuse SP, InfoEd or Click Commerce.

Experience in report writing at the enterprise level.

SQL literacy.

job_title: Senior CNSP Surface Force Training Requirements and Data Analyst
job_description:
Description: 
  Background
 Commander, Naval Surface Forces Pacific N7 Department and Afloat Training Group Pacific are responsible for the training and certification of all ships in the Pacific Fleet. ATGPAC is the Immediate Superior In Command (ISIC) for the following commands: Afloat Training Group San Diego (ATG SD) and Engineering Assessments Pacific (EAP) (located in San Diego, CA); Afloat Training Group Middle Pacific (ATG MIDPAC)(located in Pearl Harbor, HI); Afloat Training Group Western Pacific (ATG WESTPAC)(located in Yokosuka, Japan); Afloat Training Group Western Pacific Detachment Sasebo (ATG WESTPAC DET SASEBO)(located in Sasebo, Japan); and Afloat Training Group Pacific Northwest (ATG PACNW)(located in Everett, WA). Training standards and requirements are continually evolving and expanding, requiring increased manpower and flexibility. There is a substantial requirement Prevailance support to improve reliability and productivity of Commander, Naval Surface Force Pacific and Afloat Training Group Pacific in San Diego to include training standards development and analysis, monitoring, analyzing and tracking ships in training, departmental executive support, scheduling and conflict management, quality assurance, data analysis, Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) training requirements generation and certification, program management, mission area certification and information technology. Our team will provide draft/recommendations for improving CNSP/ATGPAC training standards. We will also provide program quality control, data analysis, systems administration, and perform actual training. Contractor will identify goals and objectives focusing on best business practices and technical expertise necessary to have a trained, ready fleet for immediate deployment. Requirements: 
  Knowledge/Experience Description:
 Must have 10+ years of Navy Experience, shipboard training system experience as mid-level leadership (DH, Training Team Lead, or Training Officer) and managing Department/Division routines.
 Experience (within the last five years) in the following:

 Use of the Microsoft Office Suite
 Developing and presenting PowerPoint briefs that highlight issues and solutions to higher leadership
 Conducting workshops, organize and run meetings to identify Program Objectives and Milestones (POAM)
 Produce administrative and operational efficiencies and or process improvements
 Identify, track, catalogue, and prioritize shipboard training system problems, shortfalls, and issues
 Experience working with TORIS, FLTMPS, Battle E submissions, Basic and Advanced Phase training
 Ability to conduct comparative analysis of CPF Surface Navy units executing Operational Fleet Readiness Plan (OFRP).
 Planning and Scheduling of Critical and Required Schools

 Knowledge of:

 The Surface Navy Basic Phase training processes Surface Force Training and Readiness Manual (SFTRM)
 Familiar with POM process and process to submit POM issues
 Surface Warfare Training Strategy and Fleet Training Wholeness Strategy
 Shipboard Mission Area Certification Processes
 How Ship and Fleet Non-Combat Expenditure Allowance (NCEA) is planned and promulgated.
 How Critical NECs and NEC gaps impact ship readiness and preparedness during the Training Phase

 Education:
 Bachelor’s Degree (No specific discipline)
 Security Clearance:
 Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance

At present the Government has not established a date by which EO 14042 will be enforced. Once the enforcement date is set, prospective employees must submit proof of full vaccination unless a Prevailance approved accommodation for disability (to include medical conditions) or religious-based reasons has been received.

All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status or any other consideration prohibited by law or contract. job_title: Tactical Data Link Analyst - Secret Clearance Required
job_description:
Position Title
 
 Tactical Data Link Analyst - Secret Clearance Required
 

Work Location
 
 San Diego, CA – On Client Site
 

Position Description
 Perform a technical assessment of Air C2 systems Information Exchange Requirements (IERs), TDL interfaces and system requirements under assessment for verification or evaluation.
 

Responsibilities

 Provide recommendations on which test tools, data logging options, data reduction – post-test analysis support options are suited for use for Air C2 tests to be executed. Recommendation shall provide matrices of options matched to the IERs, TDLs and interfaces.


 Provide recommended alternatives for data collection and management, primary and secondary options.


 In support of test planning and coordination meetings, provide technical input with options to Test Director, Instrumentation and Data Management (IDM) lead, and Technical Support Officer (TSO) as requested.


 Configure, connect, and prepare data collection devices.


 Perform time synchronization on data collection devices to designated time reference (Zulu/Local) and/or report devices/systems not synchronized to test director.


 Start, monitor, stop and archive data collected daily throughout the course of the supported test event.


 Organize data files, logs, and test artifacts – within an organized file management system and on appropriate media – IAW designated Command policy and guidance from test director.


 Identify and report any data loss or data collection discrepancies at the earliest opportunity to test director, test execution personnel.


 Monitor test execution noting possible exceptions to TDL standards in real-time; reporting these possible exceptions to test execution personnel working in conjunction with government personnel to track verification of Problem Change Request (PCR) resolution, MIL-STD compliance, and potential new issues.


 If applicable based on system requirements, verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6016 with consideration to system IERs (Mil-Std-6016 mission functional areas.)


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6020 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6017A/B with consideration to system IERs (Mil-Std-6017.)


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-3011 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6040 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to NATO Improved Link Eleven (NILE) references with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Perform interoperability and performance system assessment with consideration of CJCSM 6120.01 Joint Multi-Tactical Data Link Operating Procedures.


 With respect to all applicable interfaces and the system architecture, verify performance of data exchanges through intermediary applications and/or radio terminal/modem devices IAW applicable interface control documents.


 Conduct root cause analysis in support of test and engineering events.


 As required report data collected IAW the MCTSSA data management plan.


 Annotate observations of execution or deviations to TDLs standards within the test procedure.


 Execute post-test analysis and reporting within the time frame allocated by the test plan and using the forms, technical writing style and structure requested for use by the test plan/test director.
 Develop Test Plans, identifying the resources, schedule, and test cases required to achieve the test objectives.


 Develop Test Cases and Test Scripts to support systems under test and simulation tools.


 Develop scenarios and supports mission thread development.


 Develop Test Reports, ensuring that all stated requirements and test objectives have been evaluated and the documented results adequately and accurately reflect the collected data and analysis conducted during the event.


 Education/Experience

 CompTIA Security+


 JKO Joint Multi-TDL Network (MTN) Operations JT101


 TCP/IP Analysis and Troubleshooting with Wireshark


 Battlefield Operations Support System (BOSS) Standard User Training (SUT)


 Next Generation Threat System (NGTS) Standard User Training (SUT)


 Reports To
 LTE Assigned Program Manager
 

Security Clearance Requirements
 Individual must possess a valid SECRET Clearance
 

Travel Requirements
 Travel is anticipated to be 10% - 15% within the Continental United States and 5%-10% outside the Continental United States
 

Benefits & Compensation

 New employees are eligible to participate in the company’s benefits plan on their day of hire unless noted otherwise.


 Medical Insurance – 56% Employer Paid


 Vision & Dental Insurance - 70% Employer Paid
 Long Term & Short-Term Disability, Group Life and AD&D Insurance – 100% Employer Paid


 Flexible Spending Plan


 Health Savings Account


 401(k) Savings Plan – 100% match for the first 3% contributed plus 50% of the next 2% contributed. (no vesting period and eligibility is your date of hire).


 Paid holidays - Eleven (11) per year


 Paid Time Off - One hundred-twenty (120) accrued hours per year


 Professional Development Program


 Salary will be determined based on the individual’s education and experience level


 Overview
 Lumbee Tribe Enterprises, LLC (LTE) is an 8(a) certified, Tribally Owned and Operated government services provider, and subsidiary of Lumbee Tribe Holdings, Inc. (LTH), which is wholly-owned by the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina. We are a Native American, 8(a), Disadvantaged Small Business with a primary NAICS code of 561990. Our reputation for excellence is built on providing defined and repeatable support and services to agencies across the U.S. Government.

job_title: Senior Business Analyst – Research Administration and Compliance
job_description:
Job Type: Full Time
 Streamlyne is a dynamic, fast-growing SaaS company that partners with university research departments and independent research institutions. We are seeking multi-functional, experienced Senior Business Analysts that have worked in the trenches, possess strong leadership qualities, and have the ambition to keep pace with our growth trajectory. With this unique offering in a highly competitive space, we are seeking someone highly skilled to join our adventure, partner with great clients, and help us reach new heights.
 We are looking for individuals with functional experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance that have been heavily involved in an IT systems implementation.
 Streamlyne offers modules to support Pre-Award (including System-to-System proposal submission), Negotiations, Post-Award (including Subaward), IRB, IACUC, IBC, Conflict of Interest, and Export Control. Expertise in multiple areas is highly preferred. Candidates that have led an implementation will be given top priority consideration.

                This position will be aligned with a team of like-minded multi-functional Business Analysts (BAs). Business Analysts at Streamlyne are customer-facing, play many important roles, and have significant impact on the growth of the company and improvement of its products. Senior BAs will play lead roles within team projects, including all implementations.
              

























A fully-trained member of the BA Team is expected to contribute as follows:
 Marketing Duties





Complete RFP responses and/or coordinate the assignment and management of RFP tasks with teammates.

Execute software demonstrations within your area of expertise and/or coordinate participation from other analysts in demonstrations as required.

Travel to onsite demonstrations as requested (usually with other team members), manage onsite technology, and manage prospect relationships/follow-up.

Coordinate prospect software trials and serve as point of contact for related communication.

Provide input into scope analysis and solution architecture for contract development as requested.

Travel to industry conferences and events to foster industry relationships and develop leads.



Implementation Duties


Lead classroom or remote sessions to train clients on application functionality.

Lead onsite or remote analysis sessions with clients to guide them through configuration and customization decisions in alignment with their business requirements.

Successfully distinguish user requests from true underlying needs.

Create and maintain project artifacts, such as configuration documents, business requirements documents, and functional specifications.

Identifying, delegating/executing, and tracking the results of tasks that arise out of client discussions, to include configuration tasks, testing tasks, data mapping tasks, documenting tasks, general problem solving, etc., in alignment with a defined project schedule.



Product Development Duties


Participate in the development of the product roadmap, requirements and specification documentation.

Work with development teams to translate product requirements into technical requirements.

Analyze and critically evaluate industry product information gathered from multiple internal and external sources, reconcile findings, and decompose high-level information into product details for future product improvements.

Work with quality assurance personnel to ensure product adequately meets all functional needs defined in scope of any given project.




This Position Requires You To:


Be able to work at a pace required by a rapidly growing, profit-driven Ed Tech business.

Be driven to acquire and internalize new information quickly.

Possess a natural aptitude for software-supported business processes and design, to include an appreciation for formal logic and a genuine love of problem-solving.

Feel comfortable speaking in front of small and large groups of people.

Coordinate assigned work with other team members and follow up on delegated items.

Possess an intrinsic passion to pursue assigned work to the highest personal ability and integrity.

Be kind, flexible, proactive, and able to maintain productivity in the face of ambiguity.

Appreciate a fast-paced environment in which no two days are the same.

Fit into a group of highly integrated, highly communicative, fundamentally unpolitical and tightly knit but geographically dispersed team.

Proactively analyze personal progress, project progress, potential risk areas, and proactively communicate that analysis to management.

Be effective at working remotely, generally from home, serving primarily East Coast business hours but responsible for Coast-to-Coast time zones.















Qualifications





Bachelor’s degree or 7 + years’ experience in Business Analysis.

5 + years’ experience in Research Administration and/or Compliance.

Hands on experience with a research administration system.

Active participation in at least one full-lifecycle implementation project.

Superior written and oral communication skills.

Exceptional presentation and meeting facilitation skills.

Experience with and/or demonstrated ability in working as part of a geographically dispersed project team.















First Consideration Will Be Given To Candidates With:





Hands on experience with Streamlyne, Coeus, Cayuse SP, InfoEd or Click Commerce.

Experience as lead on a Research Administration-related systems implementation.

Experience in report writing at the enterprise level.

SQL literacy.
















               We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
              

























              Please send your resume and cover letter to careers@streamlyne.com along with the title of the position that you are applying for.

THOR Solutions is actively seeking a Senior Business Analyst/Portfolio Council Coordinator to join our corporate operations support contract at NIWC Pacific in San Diego, CA. In this position, the applicant serves as a conduit between NIWC PAC Business Portfolio Managers (BPMs) and outside organizations, coordinating and facilitating joint events. This individual will also review and validate project changes from BPMs, and conduct and present project status reviews to Executive leadership. The ideal candidate will possess significant experience in U.S. Navy applications and in delivering speeches/briefs to high-level government Civilian and active-duty Military customers.

Ideal experience includes:

 Proficient with common productivity software including Microsoft Office, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint.

company: Sanford Burnham Prebys Medical Discovery Institute
job_description:
Sanford Burnham Prebys is a preeminent, independent biomedical research institute dedicated to understanding human biology and disease, and advancing scientific discoveries to profoundly impact human health.
Summary:
Reporting to the Senior Director, Development Services, the Prospect Researcher/Data Analyst is a key member of the Development Services team. This position will provide expert analytics and satisfy the information needs of the development team by providing proactive research, preparing profiles and reports, verifying research data, and analyzing data on individual constituents of interest to Sanford Burnham Prebys. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

Performs prospect identification and research; meets with development staff to support activities, initiatives and programs. 
Works with major gifts officers, faculty, CEO’s office, and others as appropriate to assist in compiling briefing materials on individual prospects/donors.
Monitors prospect research trends and resources. 
Develops and maintains internal guidelines for all prospect research activities
Provides a broad range of database maintenance support including, but not limited to updating records, uploading information, and ensuring the integrity of data.
Collaborates with development staff to develop prospect identification, cultivation, solicitation, and overall fundraising strategies.
Advises development staff regarding new prospect possibilities; consults on the feasibility of research requests and special projects.
Creates profile reports tailored to specific goals and/or objectives; maintains, tracks and stores profile data. 
Maintains and updates policies and procedures for the prospect research program; proposes changes and modifications. 
Reviews local and national news, business publications, economic trends and business development keeping abreast of prospect information; provides relevant information to development staff.
Conducts periodic data updates of our CRM, proposal tracking, moves management, pulling lists, queries, and reports, managing gift processing, and plans and executes other projects as assigned within the scope of responsibility.
Recommends upgrades in hardware and software to stay on the cutting edge of strategic philanthropy database management.
Secures database by developing and monitoring the implementation of policies, procedures, and controls
Maintains a user-friendly, standardized reporting system.
Develops and maintains internal guidelines for all prospect research activities.
Updates and uploads constituent information and create new individual and organizational constituent records, and proactively audit data and work to ensure correct entry of data changes and updates to help assure data integrity.
Uses a variety of reliable sources to gather, develop and analyze research data and prepare basic and comprehensive research profiles on individuals, corporations, and foundations, including background, career, financial capacity, philanthropic interests and nature of the relationship to Sanford Burnham Prebys.
Ensures the confidentiality and integrity of all donor and prospect research-related materials.


Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor’s degree
At least 3-5 years of experience in prospect research and data collection/analysis.
Experience providing staff training in software skills, prospect research and/or database use.
Experience in training and/or presenting technical information to co-workers, leaders and/or others.


Knowledge, Skills and/or Abilities:

Technical knowledge of CRM software. Raiser’s Edge/NXT experience preferred.
Advanced technical knowledge of prospect research systems such as Lexus Nexus, WealthX, Research Point or similar. 
Must be detail-oriented, data-minded, and possess strong analytical skill. 


Must have a demonstrated track record of obtaining/uncovering funding opportunities from research.
Possess strong attention to detail, analytical, time management, organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Professional proficiency in Microsoft Office.


Supervisory Responsibilities:
This position does not have any supervisory responsibilities. 

Compensation:
Anticipated Hourly pay rate: $24.79/hour - $37.20/hour

Data Intelligence, LLC (DI) is searching for a full time Tactical Data Link (TDL) Analyst. This position is onsite in Point Loma, CA. 

 In this this position, the candidate will conduct Joint Message Standards analysis that include review, analysis and development of message standards (TDL, VMF, and USMTF), related to interoperability and system documentation. They will provide support with technical documentation review, attend interoperability meetings, and participate in the discussions, providing input for the proposal of new and revised interoperability requirements. 


Job Responsibilities:

Specific support activities will include:


Review, analyze, and provide written evaluations on system specifications, message standards, Interface Change Proposals (ICPs), and related interoperability documentation as required.
Execute evaluations and prepare reports in adherence to the applicable military and government standards, specifications, and formats.
Attend and provide technical subject matter expertise during joint interoperability technical meetings in support of the Marine Corps representative at Joint or Combined Standards meetings; report on the findings and decisions following meetings.
Provide technical and engineering support for the review, analysis and development of Marine Corps documents that provide Marine Corps users (tactical systems operators, planners, commanders, interoperability specialists, and tactical system acquisition personnel) with information that assists them in the performance of their duties.
review and analyze assigned documentation to determine technical accuracy of content, impact on command-and-control operations systems, compliance with existing standardized rules and procedures, the viability of joint interfaces, and the interoperability of Marine Corps C4I systems.
produce the Marine Corps Tactical Data Systems Reference Guide (TDSRG) and provide updates and improvements to the document.
Support in the review, analysis and development of tactical data standards that support the tenants of DOD and Marine Corps Net Centric Data Strategies; provide technical expertise supporting the migration of tactical C2 data to adopt the best approach toward net centric operations; produce analytical reports of technical studies/data modeling efforts conducted in support of the Net Centric migration of tactical C2 data as required.
Support the development and evaluation of native schemas and TDL information exchanges.
investigate various technologies, such as JAVA Script Object Notation (JSON) application schemas, to enhance TDL net centric capabilities.

Required Skills/Experience:


3+ years of experience with tactical operations, research, analysis, planning, designing, developing, or evaluating systems.
Familiarity with Joint Message Standards Analyses
Understanding of TDL, Variable Message Format (VMF), and USMTF and experience with Interface Change Proposals (ICPs)
Familiarity with iSmart/eSmart
Secret Security Clearance required

Desired:


BS in a technical field
Military Operational experience
 Data Intelligence, DI is an established small business that has supported the critical missions of our government clients since 2005. We provide full life cycle system development, systems engineering, cybersecurity, and supporting analytical and logistics support to C4ISR and other complex systems. We are an equal opportunity employer that offers competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, a team-oriented environment, and opportunities for advancement. Our excellent employee retention record reflects our employee focus. We work with Veteran's organization to proactively hire those who have served our country. We offer medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k, PTO and 11 paid holidays. 

 Data Intelligence is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Position Title: Principal Data Analyst (San Diego) JWED RDER

 This position requires a Top-Secret Clearance. In order to be considered, you must have an active Secret or Top-Secret Clearance.

 General Position Description:
 XSITE LLC is looking for qualified candidates to provide experimentation, data analysis, network architecture integration, modeling & simulation, software engineering research and development services in support of wargaming and experimentation. Experimentation will entail the full range of new initiatives including system requirements, design, implementation, and validated metrics aligned to Concept Required Capabilities (CRCs). Efforts will examine the architecture, engineering, functionality, interfaces, and interoperability of proposed initiatives that are developed and submitted to meet DoD CRCs. Evaluations will include operational experiment design and construction, operations and requirements analysis, concept formulation and development and feasibility demonstrations. Additional efforts will include requirements verification and validation, engineering & functional analysis, technical documentation, machine learning & artificial intelligence utilization, networking data design and integration with the Joint Experimentation Network (JExNet) as well as modeling & simulation testing, evaluation, and demonstration.

 Job Description:

Responsible for meta-analysis experimentation support by developing standard methods for systematically combining pertinent qualitative and quantitative data from experimentation to develop conclusions. 
Use various sources of data to confirm outcomes based on multiple experiments to enable higher confidence decision making and ensure standardized data analysis across differing types of experiments such as simulations, wargames, tabletop exercises, and field experiments 
   
This shall include the design of linked experiments using different methodologies, and search across JExNet to identify opportunities to integrate events from different experiment types to increase the analytic strength of overall findings. 

Determine how to do analysis and assessment and comparison of event in context of another event to inform gaps/needs and use it in conjunction with other events to draw larger conclusions and assign confidence values to outcomes from different types of events. 
As part of these analysis duties, the contractor shall also be capable of 
   
Contributing towards application of statistical approaches for analysis of joint experimentation data. 
Participating in development of novel quantitative approaches, or customization of statistical methods per project needs. 
Identifying analytical and computational bottlenecks involved in analysis and developing techniques to resolve them efficiently. 
Ensuring appropriateness and applicability of mathematical, statistical, or research techniques utilized 
Assisting in evaluation and documentation of statistical methodologies used; and preparing recommendations based on mathematical or statistical findings. 
Participating in report preparation to accurately summarize experimentation design, methods, analysis plans and interpretation of results. 
Performing meta-synthesis of different experimentation types using Bayesian methods to establish confidence intervals in concept required capabilities (CRCs)



 
Basic Qualifications:

BS degree in Data Science, or Computer Science; Information Systems, or Information Technology; Electrical, Software, or Systems Engineering.



 Desired skills:

Ten (10) years of direct work experience with designing and maintaining data models and structures along with data extraction and preparation processes. 
Six (6) years working with similar data structures/environments as identified in the Statement of Work (SOW) with specific experience to include: Validating data, Data Team collaboration, usage of database applications & analytical tools, data query & collection processes providing accurate and appropriate interpretation of data.

Clearance Requirements:

Top Secrete/SCI required to work on program
Active Clearance preferred and be eligible for a Top Secrete/SCI with a successful background investigation completed.



 Location: San Diego, CA / Customer Site

 Travel Anticipated: 10% or less

 Timing: XSITE anticipates a start date of: April 2023


 XSITE LLC, a Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business, provides full spectrum systems and systems-of-systems engineering and integration services and solutions for space, C4ISR, cyber and enterprise information systems. We strive to deliver expert-level systems engineering and technology integration services at affordable rates so mission, capability and user success are the #1 priority.

job_title: Senior CNSP Surface Force Training Requirements and Data Analyst
job_description:
Description: 
  Background
 Commander, Naval Surface Forces Pacific N7 Department and Afloat Training Group Pacific are responsible for the training and certification of all ships in the Pacific Fleet. ATGPAC is the Immediate Superior In Command (ISIC) for the following commands: Afloat Training Group San Diego (ATG SD) and Engineering Assessments Pacific (EAP) (located in San Diego, CA); Afloat Training Group Middle Pacific (ATG MIDPAC)(located in Pearl Harbor, HI); Afloat Training Group Western Pacific (ATG WESTPAC)(located in Yokosuka, Japan); Afloat Training Group Western Pacific Detachment Sasebo (ATG WESTPAC DET SASEBO)(located in Sasebo, Japan); and Afloat Training Group Pacific Northwest (ATG PACNW)(located in Everett, WA). Training standards and requirements are continually evolving and expanding, requiring increased manpower and flexibility. There is a substantial requirement Prevailance support to improve reliability and productivity of Commander, Naval Surface Force Pacific and Afloat Training Group Pacific in San Diego to include training standards development and analysis, monitoring, analyzing and tracking ships in training, departmental executive support, scheduling and conflict management, quality assurance, data analysis, Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) training requirements generation and certification, program management, mission area certification and information technology. Our team will provide draft/recommendations for improving CNSP/ATGPAC training standards. We will also provide program quality control, data analysis, systems administration, and perform actual training. Contractor will identify goals and objectives focusing on best business practices and technical expertise necessary to have a trained, ready fleet for immediate deployment. Requirements: 
  Knowledge/Experience Description:
 Must have 10+ years of Navy Experience, shipboard training system experience as mid-level leadership (DH, Training Team Lead, or Training Officer) and managing Department/Division routines.
 Experience (within the last five years) in the following:

 Use of the Microsoft Office Suite
 Developing and presenting PowerPoint briefs that highlight issues and solutions to higher leadership
 Conducting workshops, organize and run meetings to identify Program Objectives and Milestones (POAM)
 Produce administrative and operational efficiencies and or process improvements
 Identify, track, catalogue, and prioritize shipboard training system problems, shortfalls, and issues
 Experience working with TORIS, FLTMPS, Battle E submissions, Basic and Advanced Phase training
 Ability to conduct comparative analysis of CPF Surface Navy units executing Operational Fleet Readiness Plan (OFRP).
 Planning and Scheduling of Critical and Required Schools

 Knowledge of:

 The Surface Navy Basic Phase training processes Surface Force Training and Readiness Manual (SFTRM)
 Familiar with POM process and process to submit POM issues
 Surface Warfare Training Strategy and Fleet Training Wholeness Strategy
 Shipboard Mission Area Certification Processes
 How Ship and Fleet Non-Combat Expenditure Allowance (NCEA) is planned and promulgated.
 How Critical NECs and NEC gaps impact ship readiness and preparedness during the Training Phase

 Education:
 Bachelor’s Degree (No specific discipline)
 Security Clearance:
 Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret security clearance
 COVID-19 Requirements: All Prospective employees will be required to adhere to Prevailance’ s vaccination policy to ensure compliance with Executive Order 14042 Ensuring Adequate COVID Safety Protocols for Federal Contractors. At present the Government has not established a date by which EO 14042 will be enforced. Once the enforcement date is set, prospective employees must submit proof of full vaccination unless a Prevailance approved accommodation for disability (to include medical conditions) or religious-based reasons has been received.
 Prevailance, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, pregnancy, genetic information, citizenship status, marital status or any other consideration prohibited by law or contract. Prevailance, Inc. participates in E-Verify and is VEVRAA Compliant.

job_title: Tactical Data Link Analyst - Secret Clearance Required
job_description:
Position Title
 
 Tactical Data Link Analyst - Secret Clearance Required
 

Work Location
 
 San Diego, CA – On Client Site
 

Position Description
 Perform a technical assessment of Air C2 systems Information Exchange Requirements (IERs), TDL interfaces and system requirements under assessment for verification or evaluation.
 

Responsibilities

 Provide recommendations on which test tools, data logging options, data reduction – post-test analysis support options are suited for use for Air C2 tests to be executed. Recommendation shall provide matrices of options matched to the IERs, TDLs and interfaces.


 Provide recommended alternatives for data collection and management, primary and secondary options.


 In support of test planning and coordination meetings, provide technical input with options to Test Director, Instrumentation and Data Management (IDM) lead, and Technical Support Officer (TSO) as requested.


 Configure, connect, and prepare data collection devices.


 Perform time synchronization on data collection devices to designated time reference (Zulu/Local) and/or report devices/systems not synchronized to test director.


 Start, monitor, stop and archive data collected daily throughout the course of the supported test event.


 Organize data files, logs, and test artifacts – within an organized file management system and on appropriate media – IAW designated Command policy and guidance from test director.


 Identify and report any data loss or data collection discrepancies at the earliest opportunity to test director, test execution personnel.


 Monitor test execution noting possible exceptions to TDL standards in real-time; reporting these possible exceptions to test execution personnel working in conjunction with government personnel to track verification of Problem Change Request (PCR) resolution, MIL-STD compliance, and potential new issues.


 If applicable based on system requirements, verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6016 with consideration to system IERs (Mil-Std-6016 mission functional areas.)


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6020 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6017A/B with consideration to system IERs (Mil-Std-6017.)


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-3011 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to current joint service approved version of Mil-Std-6040 with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Analyze collected system data to verify system compliance to NATO Improved Link Eleven (NILE) references with consideration to system interfaces and capabilities.


 Perform interoperability and performance system assessment with consideration of CJCSM 6120.01 Joint Multi-Tactical Data Link Operating Procedures.


 With respect to all applicable interfaces and the system architecture, verify performance of data exchanges through intermediary applications and/or radio terminal/modem devices IAW applicable interface control documents.


 Conduct root cause analysis in support of test and engineering events.


 As required report data collected IAW the MCTSSA data management plan.


 Annotate observations of execution or deviations to TDLs standards within the test procedure.


 Execute post-test analysis and reporting within the time frame allocated by the test plan and using the forms, technical writing style and structure requested for use by the test plan/test director.
 Develop Test Plans, identifying the resources, schedule, and test cases required to achieve the test objectives.


 Develop Test Cases and Test Scripts to support systems under test and simulation tools.


 Develop scenarios and supports mission thread development.


 Develop Test Reports, ensuring that all stated requirements and test objectives have been evaluated and the documented results adequately and accurately reflect the collected data and analysis conducted during the event.


 Education/Experience

 CompTIA Security+


 JKO Joint Multi-TDL Network (MTN) Operations JT101


 TCP/IP Analysis and Troubleshooting with Wireshark


 Battlefield Operations Support System (BOSS) Standard User Training (SUT)


 Next Generation Threat System (NGTS) Standard User Training (SUT)


 Reports To
 LTE Assigned Program Manager
 

Security Clearance Requirements
 Individual must possess a valid SECRET Clearance
 

Travel Requirements
 Travel is anticipated to be 10% - 15% within the Continental United States and 5%-10% outside the Continental United States
 

Benefits & Compensation

 New employees are eligible to participate in the company’s benefits plan on their day of hire unless noted otherwise.


 Medical Insurance – 56% Employer Paid


 Vision & Dental Insurance - 70% Employer Paid
 Long Term & Short-Term Disability, Group Life and AD&D Insurance – 100% Employer Paid


 Flexible Spending Plan


 Health Savings Account


 401(k) Savings Plan – 100% match for the first 3% contributed plus 50% of the next 2% contributed. (no vesting period and eligibility is your date of hire).


 Paid holidays - Eleven (11) per year


 Paid Time Off - One hundred-twenty (120) accrued hours per year


 Professional Development Program


 Salary will be determined based on the individual’s education and experience level


 Overview
 Lumbee Tribe Enterprises, LLC (LTE) is an 8(a) certified, Tribally Owned and Operated government services provider, and subsidiary of Lumbee Tribe Holdings, Inc. (LTH), which is wholly-owned by the Lumbee Tribe of North Carolina. We are a Native American, 8(a), Disadvantaged Small Business with a primary NAICS code of 561990. Our reputation for excellence is built on providing defined and repeatable support and services to agencies across the U.S. Government.
 

Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement
 It is the policy of Lumbee Tribe Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries (the “Company”) not to discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, mental or physical disability (and medical condition, for employees in California) or because he or she is a protected veteran. It is also the policy of the Company to take affirmative action to employ and to advance in employment, all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, mental or physical disability (and medical condition, for employees in California) or protected veteran status, and to base all employment decisions only on valid job requirements. This policy shall apply to all employment actions, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, upgrading, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, recall, termination, rates of pay or other forms of compensation and selection for training, including apprenticeship, at all levels of employment.
 
 Employees and applicants of the Company will not be subject to harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, genetic information, mental or physical disability (and medical condition, for employees of Californian) or because he or she is a protected veteran. Additionally, retaliation, including intimidation, threats, or coercion, because an employee or applicant has objected to discrimination, engaged or may engage in filing a complaint, assisted in a review, investigation, or hearing or have otherwise sought to obtain their legal rights under any Federal, State, or local EEO law is prohibited.
 

NOTE:
These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work involved for this job. It is not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of this job.

THOR Solutions is actively seeking a Senior Business Analyst/Portfolio Council Coordinator to join our corporate operations support contract at NIWC Pacific in San Diego, CA. In this position, the applicant serves as a conduit between NIWC PAC Business Portfolio Managers (BPMs) and outside organizations, coordinating and facilitating joint events. This individual will also review and validate project changes from BPMs, and conduct and present project status reviews to Executive leadership. The ideal candidate will possess significant experience in U.S. Navy applications and in delivering speeches/briefs to high-level government Civilian and active-duty Military customers.
 Primary Responsibilities: The candidate’s responsibilities may include (but are not limited to) performing or supporting the following actions:

 Coordinate meetings, maintain charters and facilitate annual project/portfolio reviews.
 Request inputs from contributors, collate, organize agenda and facilitate on-site.
 Facilitate Project Status briefs, Portfolio Reviews & Strategic Sessions.
 Conduct Command-level surveys.
 Cross-reference individual stakeholder priorities to create weighted priority scores.
 Provide monthly reports to NIWC PAC Executive Director.
 Validate project statuses twice per year (ID expired projects, missing quad charts, corrections).
 Maintain Hub/SharePoint pages.

 Job Details:

 Target Pay Range: $28.00 - 34.00/hour
 Existing Security Clearance Required: This position requires a DoD Secret security clearance. A qualified candidate must already possess an active or interim Secret (or above) clearance.
 Worksite: Primarily onsite at NIWC Pacific in Point Loma, San Diego, CA. Some telework flexibility may be allowed, in accordance with NIWC’s current remote work allowance.
 Schedule: California Alternate Work Week schedule. Typically Mondays – Thursdays 9 hours daily, and Fridays alternate between 8 hours or 0 hours.
 Travel: Up to 5-10% local travel anticipated.

 Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

 Bachelor’s degree in a project/organizational management, finance, business administration or related field.
   
 In lieu of a relevant Bachelor’s degree, other qualifications such as a lesser degree, Project Management Professional (PMP) certification, or Navy Project Portal experience may be considered in conjunction with additional years of highly relevant experience.

 Five (5) to ten (10) years of recent, relevant professional experience in program, project, and/or financial management in a U.S. Navy or other Department of Defense (DoD) environment (e.g., as active duty military personnel, Civilian Government employee, and/or as a DOD-supporting contractor). Ideal experience includes:
   
 Direct experience providing formal verbal & PowerPoint presentations to Senior-level executives within DoD commands.
 Developing and coordinating multiple schedules, collecting and consolidating meeting input materials, facilitating meetings and collecting participant & viewer takeaways.
 Firsthand knowledge of NIWC PAC and NAVWAR processes and tools
 Skills in creating and editing/updating MS SharePoint sites/pages

 Certifications in Navy scheduling, planning, business and/or financial applications are highly preferred.
 Exceptional oral and written communication skills, including demonstrated confident interaction with senior/executive-level active duty military and civilian Government employees.
 Effective organizational, time management, and multi-tasking skills.
 Proficient with common productivity software including Microsoft Office, Outlook, Teams, and SharePoint.
 Some experience with MS Power BI preferred.
 Some experience with Navy Project Portal preferred.

 Typical Physical Activity:

 This position’s essential functions typically include (but are not limited to): typing, hearing, talking, and vision.

The proposed individual should have a broad knowledge of the following Microsoft Office applications (Access, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
 The Senior Logistic Analyst provides services in connection with Stock Control operation; Provide guidance in aviation supply/logistic management for ashore activities; provide analysis and measurement of supply effectiveness of ASD; collect, review, monitor and analyze data received from ashore aviation units; conduct training, assessment and inspection. Proficiency in Stock Control functions, ERP, ASD operation, NALCOMIS, AIS, RSUPPLY, NAVSUP OneTouch, FIMARS, and NAVAIR processes.

 Active Secret Security Clearance (required)
