job_title: Business Analyst - DER Billing & Value Product Team
job_description:
About the Job
 We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the Ivy Product Management Team as a member of the DER Billing and Value Product Team helping deliver solutions that provide tangible value to customers, the business, and that deliver outstanding user experiences. The DER Billing and Value Team is responsible for Ivy’s Virtual Grid platform that supports our split value solar billing programs that are the core of Ivy’s service offerings. This position reports to the lead Product Manager and works closely with the UX Designer and Tech Lead for this Product Team. In this role you will also collaborate closely with the larger product department team members within functional groups such as engineering, data science, and product management members as needed and necessary to coordinate requirements. You will be expected to focus on detailed requirements and scenario testing that inform technical features and documentation that will be necessary for the product development process, colleague knowledge transfer, and ongoing product maintenance. 

What you will be doing
 You will be working with product management to establish product roadmaps and assist in work that will help prioritize the product backlog in alignment with team and company OKRs. Supporting the product team using quantitative and qualitative data to support business decisions and by developing an understanding of the product vision, the product, users, and the external market. You will also work with the UX manager to assist in develoing, executing, and analyzing customer research, both qualitative and quantitative, to ensure we are providing value to end users. Also, you will be collaborating with the engineering team to document requirements to the team through user stories, supporting documentation, and acceptance criteria.

Performing market research and collecting customer feedback to make recommendations about product strategy, features and requirements to ensure the product is providing value to end users.
Working with internal and external stakeholders to perform initial product analysis to assess the user value for any requested features as well as their potential impact.
Driving consumer intelligence through the development of external and internal data sources that improve the business’s understanding of the product’s market, competitor activities, and customer activities.
Creating reports and dashboards to monitor product performance by creating metrics or using existing product metrics to develop a deep understanding of product health and the customer experience.
Working within Agile project methodology and participates in Scrum ceremonies, including stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, demos, grooming, and release planning.
Creating product documentation as necessary including technical requirements, acceptance criteria, roadmaps, user scenarios, user stories, and feature availability.
Working across the organization including with marketing, sales, account management, and operations to ensure a smooth launch of new products and features.
Create data catalog documentation related to product data points available to clients.
Work on technical documentation needed to support energy data and accounting driven features.
Create data feature driven design models in collaboration with the data science team to test requirements and make sure they pass scenario testing and goals.
Help with ongoing updates to utility rate research required.
Collaborate with the policy team as they evaluate new utility jurisdictions and rate differences within those markets. 

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in a related field.
Two or more years experience in product or data analysis with a proven track record of developing, communicating, and gaining consensus surrounding feature sets for a platform product supporting a consumer/employee facing product portfolio.


Demonstrated success in working with digital product teams – leading collaboration between external and internal engineering, user experience, project management, and customers.
Experience working within an Agile project methodology and participating in Scrum ceremonies, including stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, demos, grooming, and release planning.
Strong analytical skills and a drive to experiment; ability to use data to drive decision making in product development.
Proficient in using spreadsheets and database programs to manipulate and analyze data
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilities.
A critical thinker with business acumen able to find creative solutions.


Additionally Desired

Experience exploring data with Python or SQL languages.
Located in the San Diego area and able to work a flexible hybrid home and office work schedule.
Experience with financial products, distributed renewable energy, or billing services.

Benefits
 Salary Range
 $80,000- $120,000 annually
 Compensation is commensurate with various factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, qualifications, skills, training, licensure, certifications, geographic cost of labor, and other business and organizational needs.

 Benefits

Health Insurance
PTO
Sick Pay
401k Plan
Great Office Environment
Monthly Electric Vehicle & Fitness Stipends



About Ivy
 We are a team that is on a mission to evolve the way that shared buildings create, use, and think about energy.
 We connected as a team with the firm conviction that we can use technology and innovative problem solving to fix the problems that exist for distributed energy asset growth in a shared building environment. Our team comes from a variety of different backgrounds including real estate development, energy monitoring software, and solar industry operations.
 Hit Go - Team Values
 Harmony - "Enjoy what you protect."
 Innovation - "Did I create today?"
 Transparency - "Embrace open dialogue."
 Growth - "Seek beyond your comfort zone."
 Ownership - "Know your value, own your value."

Job Summary

        Here at Prosites, the Revenue Operations Analyst works closely to provide reporting and analytics support to all stakeholders on the Go-To Market team. This position plays a crucial role in providing data visualization, client analysis, internal auditing, and driving access to data. Further, this individual will be a champion of using data proactively to drive growth, and as such will also be a key member of ensuring data hygiene. To accomplish this, a successful hire will demonstrate high levels of professionalism, accuracy, curiosity, competency, and communication skills.
      

        The ideal candidate has experience owning data visualization systems, specifically PowerBI, and is highly proficient with Salesforce. They also have a proven history of managing a database for field completion and data accuracy, and some experience in sourcing missing information when necessary. This candidate is extremely skilled with Excel; knowledge of connecting the workbook to Salesforce via Power Query and manipulating object data without pivot tables are examples of regular work activities. Has moderate familiarity with the digital marketing industry (understands what SEO is, how it works on a high level, and why companies do it).
      


 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


 Work directly with stakeholders to understand and drive their analytical needs, including identifying critical KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
 Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders regarding improvements in business performance
 Provide regular updates on the progress of initiatives and team performance, with non-exhaustive examples including metrics for executive meetings, board presentations, acquisitions, rep performance management, etc.
 Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources.
 Maintain databases by acquiring and managing data from primary and secondary sources and auditing for data hygiene.
 Build reusable reports within Excel for stakeholders across the organization.


 Qualifications (Required):


 Extremely strong Excel skills are required to be successful in this position. Candidates must feel extremely comfortable using complex formulas and connecting workbooks to Salesforce via Power Query for refreshable data manipulation.
 2+ years of Salesforce experience, with 1+ years of experience as a Salesforce Admin.
 2+ years of experience working cross-functionally with stakeholders at all levels.
 2+ years of proven experience managing the quality of an internal database.
 1+ year of Power BI experience building drillable, actionable reports and dashboards connected to both static and dynamic sources
 Proven track record of analytical skills, data mining, evaluation, analysis and extrapolation, and data visualization.
 Advanced presentation skills.


 Qualifications (Preferred):


 Salesforce Administrator certification is preferred
 Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification is preferred
 Experience with ethical web-scraping
 Experience developing in VBA (write macros for automation/creation of reporting)


 Physical/Mental Requirements for the Job:


 Prolonged periods of seating
 Frequent usage of electronics, including but not limited to computers and/or smart devices
 May be requested to work overtime and weekends if deemed necessary
 Must be able to lift at least 20 pounds
 Certain management positions might be required to occasional travel

job_title: Planning Master Data Analyst (Supply Chain and Operations)
job_description:
As a Planning Master Data Analyst with a focus on supply chain and operations, you will be responsible for ensuring accurate and consistent master data management across various systems and processes. You will play a critical role in maintaining data integrity, standardization, and governance, while supporting supply chain and operations functions within the organization. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify, analyze, and resolve data-related issues to support efficient supply chain and operational processes.
 Essential Duties and Responsibilities 

Manage and maintain master data for supply chain and operations, including but not limited to product data, vendor data, costing data, and inventory data, in various systems such as ERP, MRP, and other relevant databases (SAP, SAP Integrated Business Planning, & AGILE).
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity through data validation, data cleansing, and data enrichment techniques.
Will be a key participant of the change management process to ensure the quality of the data is accurate across multiple databases. 
Manage the Planning SKU and Planning BOM assignments, associated settings, and ensuring accurate transitions to released materials as they become available.
Maintain purchasing info record data in SAP. Managing pricing updates, PDTs, and involvement in material to vendor assignments.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including supply chain, operations, procurement, and IT, to identify data issues, analyze root causes, and implement corrective actions.
Participate in cross functional product life cycle change management processes and incorporate appropriate attributes and data sets to ensure correct outputs.
Develop and implement data governance policies, procedures, and standards to ensure data quality and consistency across the organization’s databases.
Provide support for data-related inquiries, data analysis, and data reporting to internal stakeholders.
Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to optimize master data management processes and enhance data quality.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and regulatory requirements related to master data management, supply chain, and operations.

Requirements
 The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Strong attention to detail and analytical skills with the ability to quickly work through large data sets and identify patterns and discrepancies.
Basic understanding of supply chain and operations concepts, processes, and systems.
Good documentation practices, familiarity with quality documentation controls and change management processes.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in using data management tools, software, and technologies such as Excel, ERP systems, MRP systems, and data visualization tools (SAP Experience preferred)
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and adapt to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of data governance principles and best practices is a plus.

Education and Experience

Minimum undergraduate, bachelor (BS/BA) degree, preferably in related field.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in related field, preferably in an SAP environment.

For roles based in the United States that require access to hospital facilities, must be eligible for and maintain credentials at all required hospitals, including meeting any applicable physical requirements or vaccination requirements (including the COVID-19 vaccine, as applicable).

Further, ATEC will make reasonable accommodations that are necessary to comply with disability discrimination laws.

 Salary Range
 Alphatec Spine, Inc. complies with state and federal wage and hour laws and compensation depends upon candidate’s qualifications, education, skill set, years of experience, and internal equity. $60,000 to $65,000 Full-Time Annual Salary

Job Summary:

 The Senior FP&A Analyst will analyze past financial performance to predict future performance and to advise the company on its financial strategy. This position will be responsible for budgeting, financial planning, and forecasting processes. The ideal candidate will have experience as an FP&A for a global organization.

 Duties/Responsibilities:

Analyses business and financial data.
Creates financial models bases on analyses to support organizational decision making.
Develops financial plans and reports for organizational leaders.
Produce KPI reporting and root cause trends in KPIs. Prepare insights for variance and Key Reviews.
Analyzes industry trends and makes recommendations based on those trends.
Evaluates capital expenditures and depreciation.
Develops automated reporting and forecasting tools for more efficient use of data.
Responsible for planning and creating the budget in collaboration with department leaders.
Work closely with the Executive team to create short and long-term financial plans.
Provide detailed analysis on performance of products and departments.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

Requirements
 Required Skills/Abilities:

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Highly skilled in Excel and able to use advanced level formulas to analyze data.
Experience using cloud-based ERP (NetSuite ERP preferred).
Thorough understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP).
Thorough understanding of methods of systems analysis and the principles, design, and procedural methods used in big data analysis.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.




Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field required.
Two years of professional experience as an FP&A preferred, OR experience as an accountant, or auditor.


Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times. 

Benefits

Company Benefits:

Fully Paid Health Insurance for employees (Medical, Dental & Vision)
401k with employer match on 4%

Paid Time Off

Casual work environment

Overview: 
 
   NV5 is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.
 


 As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on 
  Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives



 In the GIS analyst role, you will collaborate with other members of the GIS team on the scope and schedule of projects. You will be expected to maintain extensive knowledge in ESRI software solutions and successfully analyze data and present data visualizations. Success in this role will be demonstrated by providing support and expertise in the development of the firm’s GIS capabilities to meet strategic objectives.
  Responsibilities:

 Designs and edits GIS data for numerous projects
 Ensures alignment of data with company standards
 Monitors and applies the best industry practices
 Maintains data integrity and accuracy
 Utilizes ArcGIS Desktop, ArcGIS Pro, or ArcGIS Online in data visualization and analysis
 Manages necessary hardware and software
 Delivers training and technical support to end-users
 Qualifications: 
 
   GIS Analyst Job Requirements:
 

 3-5 years of experience with ArcGIS 
 GISP certification preferred 
 Solid cartographic skills 
 Outstanding project management and facilitation skills 
 Detail-oriented and excellent written and verbal communication skills 
 Bachelor’s degree in GIS Analysis, Environmental Science, Geography, or related field

job_description:
Senior Insurance & Risk Advisory Analyst 
  Location: San Diego, CA (On-Site)
  5-month assignment 
  Pay: $40-43 / HR
 
 Our public energy client is looking for a Senior Insurance & Risk Advisory Analyst to join their team. This individual will serve as the primary contact from the insurance and risk team to identify and assess potential risks.
 

Responsibilities:

Review contracts of various size and scope and recommend potential risk transfer solutions and/or other mitigation alternatives. 
Primary point of contact for certificate of insurance program and letters of self- insurance and corporate surety bond program. 
Review and process insurance policy invoices into SAP.
Collaborate and assist with organizing underwriting data requests; complete insurance applications and create underwriting submissions for insurance renewals.
Team knowledge manager responsible for uploading and maintaining the insurance and risk database.
Monitor receipt, and assists in reviews for accuracy, of insurance binders, policies, and endorsements.
Prepare monthly schedule of insurance to capture details of all insurance programs and premiums, as required.


Education & Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Risk Management, Engineering, Finance and related field.
Strong Project Management skills
5+ years of work experience in corporate risk management or insurance brokerage firm / company.
Knowledge of technical and practical aspects of risk management and corporate insurance.
Experience reviewing vendor contracts to identify risks and insurance levels.

Please submit your resume in Word and PDF format to be considered.

Job Description

 Digital Platforms & Engineering Finance (DPE)
 Position: Financial Analyst III
 Hiring Manager: Sr Manager, Finance
 Location: Hybrid Waltham, MA; Carlsbad, CA; or Pittsburgh, PA

 How you’ll make an impact!

 This individual will work with their direct leadership to drive Thermo Fisher Scientific’s planning and analytics and labor charge back process across our DPE and IT Shared Services teams. The ideal candidate has a consistent track record as an experienced high potential talent demonstrating drive, ambition, financial and analytical acuity, and emotional intelligence.

 This position will partner with the Finance leadership team and business by bringing strong capabilities in forecasting and analysis, trend identification, and insight generation to support impactful reporting, along with effective process management. They will link to finance colleagues across Global IT Finance to ensure alignment financially and around core results for Corporate FP&A.

 1. Providing financial planning and analysis support to the Digital Engineering and the Global IT Shared Service organizations around monthly/quarterly reporting, and planning/forecasting mechanisms.
 2. Developing the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and monthly forecasts; conducting variance analysis; preparing AR financials and other ad hoc analysis related to labor.
 3. Completing key month-end close processes and post-close reporting for operating expenses.
 4. Run labor chargeback process for all of IT shared services.
 5. Delivering operational improvements to drive efficiency and customer ease of use.

 What will you do!

 Partnership: Ability to build organizational relationships with customers, peers and operating partners.
 Thought Leadership: Ability to independently make logical assumptions, identify trends, and effectively utilize data to evaluate business performance.
 Financial Domain: Proficiency in the following areas: financial analysis and reporting, forecasting, process controls, and accounting knowledge specifically related to capitalization of software development activities.
 Process Acuity: Strong skills with MS Excel (management and synthesis of large data sets) and MS PowerPoint (compelling storytelling), along with Oracle, HFM, and COGNOS (financial system proficiency).
 Adaptability: Ability to work cross-functionally with individuals and teams from different areas and drive continuous operational improvement in daily activities.

 How will you get here?

 High Potential Talent: A strong Financial Analyst with a proven track record as a top talent demonstrating consistent performance, drive, flexibility and financial acuity.
 Leadership: Able to execute key financial processes and provide positive relationship with finance colleagues and business leaders to succeed against goals
 Balance: Effectively balance/flex between performing day-to-day finance responsibilities, while partnering on the operational aspects of business processes to execute on key priorities of the finance team.
 Results-Oriented: Able to exceed goals, implement consistently, and deliver outstanding results; shown ability to lead multiple projects and/or results simultaneously and partner with across teams in a fast-paced environment.
 Subject Matter Authority: Be a go-to person for areas of ownership.
 Data-Focused: Acquire and analyze data and use it to drive your forecasting and identification of risks and opportunities of financial results vs plan.
 Passion: Demonstrate a passion for the customer experience, culture, mission, and vision, and how digital can be used to improve operations. Dedication to continuous learning, career progression and development, and seeking stretch opportunities.
 Innovative: Challenges the status quo of core processes and uses prior finance experience to drive innovative solutions and daily efficiency.
 Communication: Clear and concise written, verbal and social skills.

 Minimum Qualifications:

 Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field.
 Minimum 5 years of experience in a Finance or Accounting role.

At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.

 Job Description
 WCIB Data Engineer & Data Analyst
 Wealth, Corporate, Commercial and Institutional Banking (WCIB) at US Bank manages approximately $9B in revenue, $3.1B in net income and generates approximately 37% of overall revenue for the bank. Corporate and Commercial Banking offers lending, equipment finance and smallticket leasing, depository services, treasury management, capital markets services, international trade services and other financial services to middle market, large corporate, commercial real estate, financial institution, non-profit and public sector clients. Wealth Management and Investment Services provides private banking, financial advisory services, investment management, retail brokerage services, insurance, trust, custody and fund servicing through four businesses: Wealth Management, Global Corporate Trust & Custody, U.S. Bancorp Asset Management and Fund Services.
 WCIB’s relationship-oriented teams are immersed every day in the management of their relationships with the wealth, commercial and institutional client segments. Each of these teams has a deep understanding of their clients’ needs and regularly partner with enterprise analytics to help bring the full spectrum of WCIB offerings to meet these needs.
 We are looking for top notch analyst to provide analytics support to our WCIB business stakeholders with hungry, curious and do-whatever-it-takes attitude. Our analyst is an expert professional who works independently. This position is responsible for drawing solutions from multiple domains and weaponizing data.
 You, your team and its culture:
 You will work with an amazingly agile multi-cultural team that is helping to build tomorrow’s bank. The team is rapidly growing both in terms of its influence and impact. You will experiment, build strong relationships, learn complexities of banking, observe data along with human behavior/incentives, drive digital adoption, lead new ways of doing business and get to be a true champion of impactful, industry-leading data-driven analytic solutions. Team encourages open culture, free exchange of thoughts and fosters a startup mentality.
 Your day to day:
 Responsibilities include working on big data/analytics projects, including gathering and integrating large volumes of data, performing analysis, interpreting results and developing actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company. This includes hands on data development, designing, developing and maintaining data pipelines and infrastructure to ensure the availability, accuracy and performance of our data dashboards. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources and systems including data mining, data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation. This position may also have a working knowledge of analytics and statistical software such as SQL, R, Python, Excel, Hadoop, SAS, SPSS, Geo-spatial tools and others to perform analysis, interpret data and build advanced analytic solutions.
 You will also work on advancing the development of metrics, reports and analysis into integrated dashboards that support field-based relationship managers and product leaders in Wealth, Corporate, Commercial and Institutional Banking (WCIB). Through the deep understanding of your users and the data you will consult on statistical analysis performed by your Data Science peers as well as contribute to measuring the key business outcomes as new analytic products are tested with the relationship manager and leadership team in WCIB. You get to work with leading ML and AI tools – both on-prem and cloud. This role will also play an active role with other data engineers, Salesforce experts, and business line product owners in the business line ensuring the critical data is available and reliable in the proper platforms with clear SLAs.

 Key Deliverables: 
Communication/Presentation

 Communicate complex data concepts, metrics and dashboards to a non-technical audience.
 Engage with business stakeholders, challenge assumptions and build industry leading analytical solutions.
 Partnering with new and existing data vendors.


 Domain Expertise

 Quickly learn complex B2B banking dynamics and design data-driven solutions that create competitive differentiation.
 Familiarity and understanding of banking and investment products and services.


 Data Engineering 

Wrangle, join and create new data from a variety of different sources and efficiently create a unified user-friendly dashboard for the business.
 Enable a data foundation that includes advanced analytic solutions for RM’s that allows them to find, track and discover opportunities.
 Research data assets from multiple disparate sources, applies various technologies find and move data assets for analysis, development of metrics, reports, and statistics.
 Documenting calculations, code, and adhering to data management principles
 Validating and testing data assets of others in the form of peer review
 Identify and lead the remediation of key data quality issues impacting Salesforce and our ability to deliver
 Participate in the buildout of the analytics delivery, reporting and technology infrastructure required to support the delivery of insights and reporting.


 Analytics / Data Science

 Exploring statistical analysis that could be applied to the data; Performing descriptive statistics, exploring datasets, building visualizations iteratively to explore and understand the data
 Conduct exploratory analysis and partner with data science team to design ML/AI solutions


 Dashboard Development

 Building business friendly dashboards in Microsoft Power BI or similar dashboarding tool such as Tableau.
 Delivery of advanced analytic solutions via modern BI tools that prioritizes potential new leads to improve prospecting, data for deepening engagement within our existing client set, and reducing the risk of attrition.

 Innovation

 Curiosity and proactiveness to research new and cutting-edge data sourcing and development technologies such as web scraping, text analytics and NLP.


 Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent work experience
Five to Seven years of statistical and/or data analytics experience


 If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.

 Benefits:
 Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):

 Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)
 Basic term and optional term life insurance
 Short-term and long-term disability
 Pregnancy disability and parental leave
 401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan
 Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)
 Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities
 Adoption assistance
 Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law


 EEO is the Law
 U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services.

Kalman & Company is seeking a highly motivated, performance driven individual with strong defense cost analysis experience to work closely with our government clients. This would be a hybrid role out of San Diego. Successful candidates will have excellent communication, quantitative, research, and analytical skills and the capability to lead, or principally contribute to, several of the largest and most significant studies in Kalman's portfolio. The compensation range for this position is $115K-$145K (salary offered will be commensurate with the candidate's level of experience).
A career with Kalman & Company, Inc. is both rewarding and challenging. Our clients require skilled, hardworking, innovative support service providers who can meet the demands of a dynamic and fast-paced workplace.
Take advantage of the benefits of a Hybrid Team: 

We know that great people make a great company, so we value our people by offering employees a broad range of competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.
Exciting time in Kalman’s growth as we expand to larger sectors, creating more opportunities for our employees and clients.
You’ll personally be working for a team at the nexus of innovation and impact serving the JPEO-CBRND and its stakeholders.
Our employees value the flexibility at Kalman that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.
Report on-site 1-2 days a week for maximum team collaboration and effective in-person communication, allowing needed connection real-time.
Flexible, remote and on-site work structure to meet your life’s pace while still meeting client’s needs during core work hours.
Generous PTO allotment that rolls over and never expires so you can save and spend when it’s best for you! 

Specific Duties

Lead the development and maintenance of cost, affordability, and schedule analysis in support of Department of Navy (DoN) major acquisition programs.
Coordinate with a variety of stakeholders (senior government leadership, competency leads, etc.) to collect and communicate information to help ensure the success of priority programs.
Conduct planning analyses, cost as an independent variable analysis, and Earned Value Management (EVM) analyses, implement estimating methodologies, and analyze data to support cost models build efforts.
Document and defend cost analyses including time-phased Life Cycle Cost Estimates (LCCEs), Acquisition Program Baseline (APB) Section C, Business Case Analyses (BCAs), Economic Analyses (EAs), Analyses of Alternatives (AoAs), cost/risk uncertainty analysis, trend/variance analysis, and Program Objective Memoranda (POM) budget submissions.
Develop Acquisition Strategies and other acquisition-related documentation to support program milestone decisions and gate reviews.
Develop cost databases, cost estimating relationships, and cost factors.
Build and defend budget requirements.
Forecast future funding needs.
Evaluate contracting courses of action.
Assess sustainment costs associated with acquisition decisions.
Lead the preparation of briefing materials and other communications packages and present analysis results to program leadership and outside agencies/organizations.
Work autonomously and as part of a team to meet organizational and project goals.
Possess a strong understanding of DoN acquisition processes.
Understand the customer mission.
Address business challenges with creative problem solving.


 
Required Education/Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in any field and successful completion of three semester hours of calculus and twenty-one semester hours in operations research, economics, math, chemistry, physics, or other sciences where the utilization of advanced math skills in geometry, trigonometry, statistics, probability, and/or quantitative analyses was required.
US Citizenship is required.
Five or more years of DoD Cost Estimating, Integrated Program Management, EVM, and/or Scheduling experience with large-scale IT and ERP systems
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Automated Cost Estimating Integrated Tools (ACEIT), and uncertainty/risk software packages (Crystal Ball, @Risk, SEER)
Ability to lead detail-oriented tasks and multi-task under minimal supervision.
Excellent analysis skills and experience working with large data sets.
Experience supporting BCAs, AoAs, EAs, or other analytics studies.
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

An Active Secret Clearance or higher is preferred.
Certification in cost estimation, Integrated Program Management, and/or EVM by a recognized professional society or educational organization (CCEA, DAWIA level II, AACE EVP, PMI, PMP, etc.)

Through our acquisitions of SOLUTE in January 2022 and Sub U Systems in May 2022, we have expanded our software and communications hardware solutions to better support JADC2, C5ISR, SATCOM, and DEVSECOPS for customers in the Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and Space Force. Through a combination of hardware, software, and industry expertise, we provide a complete portfolio of solutions and services that accelerates information collection and sharing for faster decision making and better mission outcomes. 
Why would you work for us? Quite simply, the work we do is meaningful and stimulating. We promote initiative and independent thought; we encourage direct client engagement to ensure we are delivering what the customer wants; and our engineers and scientists are working on cutting-edge projects that move the state-of-the-art closer to the people who need them. If you're looking for technical challenges and an opportunity to take a leadership role in an environment that encourages you to excel, then WE are your destination.
 We are a company of innovative professionals thriving in a highly motivating work environment that fosters creativity and independent thinking. If you are a motivated individual with a desire to support our service men and women, now is a great time to join Sigma Defense!

 We are seeking a talented Senior Navy Surface Warfare Officer to join the SMWDC team to lead the Surface Warfare Combat Systems Training Continuum (SWCTC) as the Senior expert reporting to directly to SWDC CAG and Front Office leadership. Must have a current SECRET Clearance and 12+ years as a qualified Surface Warfare Officer. You will support SMWDC HQ, FFC, CPF, CNSF and OPNAV in capability assessments across all SMWDC-owned mission area capabilities. You will support, assist, review and make recommendations to ensure all SWCTC requirements are planned for and executed IAW program time lines. 
You will develop plans and programs that will improve war fighting performance and readiness of the surface forces and integrate those SWCTC requirements into the SEWTC, IPCL, FTW and other formal budgeting plans. You will evaluate, assess and monitor unit-level mission area readiness and operational capability through direct observation or indirect analysis of performance metrics to support units’ preparation for, and completion of the advanced training phase.
 Requirements

At least 10 years of recent experience in electronic training database systems such as RADM, TORIS/TFOM and FLTMPS.
At least 12 years of recent experience as a Qualified SWO.
At least 4 years recent experience with Surface Warfare training cycles.

Recent experience working in or with the training department of Afloat Training Group, Surface Warfare Officer School or major Navy staff (Commander Naval Surface Forces Pacific/Commander Naval Surface Forces Atlantic/Numbered Fleet).

Personnel Clearance Level:

job_title: Lead Business Analyst - Guidewire Policy Center
job_description:
We Are:
 Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

 You Are:
 A talented application PolicyCenter Business Analyst with deep knowledge of Guidewire PolicyCenter application solutions. You will be able to drive the client conversations and lead the team of Business Analysts to develop the Product Model using the APD tool. You’re skilled in all aspects of Guidewire implementation, from design and configuration to customization and support after the solution goes live. You enjoy working with people with all different skill sets, and you have a flair for negotiating and gaining consensus in a fast-paced environment. You have plenty—you’re a master at juggling multiple tasks and meeting deadlines. Planning and strategizing come easily to you, and you have a take-charge approach to seeing tasks through to completion.

 The Work:

 Lead a team of Business Analysts to develop the Product Model using APD
 Gathered Product Model requirements using Mind Map applications
 Develop functional specifications in the form of User Stories, process flows, use cases, and data mappings leveraging tools such as JIRA, Confluence, Rally, etc.,
 Lead business tracks, requirement elicitation workshops, writing user stories, UI mock-up, product model, workflow processes, forms, rating
 Work in the global delivery model and be a liaison between the client and software development team across different geographies.
 Work in a fast-paced Agile (Scrum/SAFe) and multiple stakeholder environments
 Work with Requirements Manager, Scrum Master, and Program Manager for various project activities




What You Need:

 Minimum of 10 Years experience with Insurance
 Minimum of 5 plus years with Guidewire PolicyCenter
 Minimum of 2 years experience in the development of Product Model using APD
 Experience with a minimum of 2 Guidewire PolicyCenter (PC) implementations, including one with Guidewire Cloud
 Experience in leading a team of Business Analysts
 Hands-one experience writing user stories, Integration Specifications, Mock-up, Field level specifications, type lists, Forms, Guidewire Product Models, and/or data mapping
 Hands-on experience working on Guidewire data dictionary, Product design, underwriting rules etc.
 Guidewire PolicyCenter ACE Business Analyst certification
 Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years’ work experience). If Associate’s Degree, must have equivalent (minimum 6-year working experience)
 Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.


 Bonus Points:

 Business analyst certification by IIBA
 Agile certification such as Scrum/ SAFe etc.
 Insurance certification CIP, AINS, CPCU
 Experience using management tools like Confluence, Jira, Rally, Microsoft Office suite, Visio and the ability to query SQL DB and analyze results.

 Requesting An Accommodation
 Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired.
 If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter.
 Other Employment Statements
 Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.
 Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.
 Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.
 The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Company's legal duty to furnish information.
